Title: Stopped working after 7 months
Review: I got these Airpods in late March 2020. I went to use them today, Oct 2020, to make a call and my cell was not connecting. I've shutdown my cell, plugged the Airpod cord to another outlet, pushed the button on the back of the airpod case, and tried to connect with another cell phone and nothing worked. The light on the case never would come on. I keep the case plugged in most of the time and it's generally charging every day. Now, I'm going to have to find an apple store so they can see if it's defected. I would be livid if I lived in a small town that had no apple store. Hopefully, my experience with this at the store will be a good one as it's been less than a year since I've purchased these.

Title: Stay in my ears
Review: Earbuds with the rubber tips have never fit my ears very well — they either fall out easily or hurt after a while. But Apple’s wired earbuds have always fit way better for me, and the same is true of the AirPods! The sound quality is good enough for listening to music or watching a tv show. I wouldn’t do music production or sound mixing with them, but that’s not really what these are for anyway.The new IOS 14 update makes these MUCH more convenient. When switching between my iPad and iPhone, the airpods seamlessly switch over automatically.

Title: YES THEY ARE 1st GEN, but they are still great!
Review: I bought these to use at work instead of my over the ear beats because wearing those huge headphones isn’t a great look at work. I wasn’t expecting them to sound amazing, but the sound quality is comparable to my beats that were 3x the price. They are definitely by apple; I’ve watched enough YouTube videos to be able to spot fakes. Mine are definitely 1st gen. This is how you can tell:If the picture on the back of the box includes the charger, it is 1st gen. The 2nd gen AirPod box doesn’t feature a picture of the charging cable on the back; all you’d see are the AirPods in their case. The 2nd gen case also has a tiny little dot on the front, a light that turns on when the case is charging wirelessly. The 1st gen case does not have that feature, so, of course, there’s no light on the front.But seriously, that’s the only feature you’re missing out on, other than maybe some better sound quality that you won’t really miss unless you’ve used 2nd gens before. Again, these are really great.

Title: Definitely worth every penny and then some
Review: I love my AirPods. I thought about getting the AirPods Pro but I didn’t wanna spend that much more just to have the noise canceling feature. Now I will probably upgrade in a year or two now that they’ve even improved the AirPods Pro even more.Coming from somebody who has an iPad and iPhone and an iMac at home having the AirPods and the ability to Switch between them so effortlessly without having to unpair and repair is so nice.I’ve had a number of Bluetooth headsets over the years from Plantronics to generic to a number of other different companies I don’t even know if I could remember every different manufacture that I’ve had. I always hated that they were bulky they never fit in my ear just right. I just never felt like they were great and it was always complicated they seem to fuss to pair up and especially if they ever unpaired then it was starting all over again. I love that the minute that I got my AirPods I flipped open the case and right away my iPhone registers that they are there and with the top of a Button on my phone and the top of the button on the AirPods in a couple of seconds I am paired up.I also have a very nice charger that I bought right here on Amazon for about $25 and it will charge my Apple Pencil my AirPods my Apple Watch and my iPhone all at the same time which is amazing and so nice that I can just click my AirPods case on there and they charge up in a very short time.First off I’m not a sound engineer or an audio file so I can’t say that they have the absolute best sound quality and I’m sure that they don’t I can’t imagine that if you went out and got some of the beads or some other type of wireless headset that fits over your entire ear with a bigger driver in it that of course it’s going to have better sound quality.But I love that they are tiny small and easy to just throw in the case. The battery life is great if my case is fully charged with the AirPods in and charged I can go to complete times to almost dead with both AirPods being used. If I only use one way talking on the phone I can go even more so in between case charging times is sometimes over a week which is absolutely amazing. The talk time on them is very long as well. I’ve never sat down and figured up exactly whether I get the exact time that Apple says.I love that the minute that I put them in my ear I get a nice little tone to let me know that they’ve connected if I’m listening to music and I take them out it automatically pauses. I love that it will even pause my music if I get an iMessage and it will read my message it will tell me who it’s from if they’re in my contact list if not it will read me the phone number and then read me the message and then asked me if I would like to respond all without touching my phone.I love Apple products even if they are a little more expensive in some areas but I love that for instance with the AirPods home they tie Effortlessly Into my phone my Mac and my iPad.I absolutely hate when I am talking on the phone for more than a couple of minutes to have to hold the phone. Also I run a business and so I have to multitask sometimes someone calls and I need to be able to pick up a remote to navigate to something to check I may need to grab the computer etc. and having the ability to have both hands free to do something like that while still talking and not worrying about the AirPods falling out of my ear is worth more than the money that I paid for them by far and then all the other features that come with it are great.So in the end I think that they are amazing and I’ve had it again a number of different Bluetooth headsets and they never fit right they fall out of my ear or the ones that took over my ears are always so uncomfortable after a short period of time that I never ended up using them I always ended up using my wired earbuds that come with my iPhone.

Title: Cool headphone great sound quality
Review: I bought these for my daughter for her birthday. Sometime they have a connecting issue but it’s easy to resolve.They are great headphones. The sound quality when listening to music is excellent. Some phone calls are muffled, but most are crystal clear. I love That they can detect when they are in your ear and when they are not. When listening to music my daughter prefers them both in her ear she said it’s not as loud with one. These also have a locator on them if you lose them they can give off a siren noise to find them. They do slide out the ear. It’s annoying to me but my daughter doesn’t seem too bothered by it. Overall great headphones. And to answer many questions you can pair your AirPods with other devices. If you tap your air pods it can answer your phone calls and end them. If your listening to music and you tap them twice they can switch to the next song

The battery life would get 5 stars if it lived up to the specification but for for some reason one of my airpods loses battery life faster. When the battery begins to drop under 30% one of them always drops about 10% lower than the other even though I’m using both of them at the same time. I don’t know if this is normal of if I received a defective unit. I bought apple care for these but all the apple stores are currently closed. I don’t think that is normal and I’d expect more from a $130+ product.

Title: I use them everyday
Review: I have an iPhone and wanted a good pair of wireless headphones but without Apple's price. After trying about 6 different brands and returning them or just wasting money on them I decided to bite the bullet and just get the Air Pods, now I wish I did it sooner. They sound great, I like that I can just say Hey Siri to change the volume, and they are so useful. I use them daily when working by either listening to music when working on a project or talking to customers, I also use them when mowing the lawn or just running to the store. These do not noise canceling but they isolate the background noise well but not to the point where you cant hear around you. I am surprised on how long the battery actually lasts for such a small package, also the storage case/charger is great because if I am running low on power I just plug them in for 15 min or so and have enough power to take several more calls.I would recommend these to others and I am even going to buy a pair for my fiance to replace her off the wall wireless earbuds.

Title: Use everyday, great sound, seamless integration. Good job Apple!
Review: Amazing! Worth the money. I was on the fence of getting the new AirPod Pros or the AirPod 2nd Generation. I’m glad I went with the 2nd Gen AirPods. They are extremely comfortable. Sometime I forget they’re in (no bull...). It connects so seamlessly to my iPhone and feels like it belongs. I tried the Jabras... uncomfortable and no touchless “Hey Siri”. This even reads messages to you or can annouce who’s calling by tweaking some of your General Settings. I use them everyday. Start my morning with Youtube and Apple News updates, make calls, listen to music while working. They seem expensive but it’s worth the money. I also like that they don’t cancel out all of the noise and also work independently (I usually only have one in). However, when I really want full sound for music, I put both in and can barely hear the wind and road noise, on the highway, with the windows down. Good job Apple!

Title: It is impossible to fathom that Apple can't figure out bluetooth for Windows PC
Review: Airpods from Apple work seamlessly, perfectly fine with an Iphone. However, they keep disconnecting, at times even during the calls on Zoom or Teams. Even connecting it to Bluetooth is so troublesome that I have to restart the system to get it to work. I am not the only person who has faced this issue; I have checked with four friends of mine, who also have faced the same problem.Either Windows or Apple is deliberately screwing up the system to not allow this thing to work seamlessly with Windows. Overall, it is impossible to fathom that Apple can't figure out bluetooth for Windows PC.There is no doubt that it took decades for other firms, and yet they couldn't figure out the shape of the ears and design a comfortable handsfree for human ear. The airpod design even from the wired stage, is the first and even now as well, the only one which fits comfortably in the human ear without causing a feling of pluggedness.It is a pity that I had to return this product.

Title: Just because its apple doesnt mean its always the best
Review: Overall the airpods are ok, but they're very expensive when you could easily spend the money elsewhere and get somewhat similar quality bluetooth headphones. Not always does the battery life display on your phone or device sometimes i have to open and close the case a few times for the phone and or ipad to be able to see my device. It doesnt always connect either, thats another thing I dont like about these things. Also they can fall out easily from your ears and thats really ridiculous when you're already paying a premium price for the things. I have a pair of Bluetooth tenergy headphones that are water proof and bluetooth and do not fall out of my ears whatsoever because they have these black arms that wrap around the backs of your ears. They only costed me like $30 bucks and here im spending much more and they dont even stay in my ears at all.

Title: These are in fact gen 2 airpods in a gen 1 case
Review: First off These are gen 2 airpods in a gen 1 case so it comes with the added Siri functionality and such, just not the wireless charging of course. They sound pretty crisp for the most part, and they embrace bass instead of being allergic to it like some cheaper wireless earbuds. They charge really really fast too, 15 minutes of charging for 3 hours of playtime! The experience is seamless, everything works as it should consistently. Title: Definitely recommend!
Review: Awesome investment! They don’t fall out of my ears, which I was afraid of. They have great features that allow you to assign functions to each ear bud for touch-sensitivity (to control volume, skip the track, or repeat the track). They pair automatically to your iPhone and connect to MacBook Pro and iPad Pro to use as microphones and/or headphones! Great sound quality and charge super quickly!!

Title: These are used!!!
Review: These are used AirPods. I received a box that looked like it had been in the garbage and the AirPods themselves were dirty. I was not expecting used AirPods and I even checked the description to make sure I didn’t miss anything. No where did it say they were going to be used or refurbished. So I contacted support. I asked why the item was used and it didn’t say it was on the description and the rep really made it seem like they did not want to answer my question and just asked me if I could return the item. I asked if they were authentic Apple AirPods and if they would be new and she said yes so I agreed to get a replacement. The replacement was also a used or refurbished pair. Oh and the original pair I received wouldn’t even pair to my iPhone. I’ve returned both sets and am still waiting for a refund weeks after I returned them.

Title: Buy Skull Candy Sesh XT Evo’s!!!
Review: Overpriced! Buy Skull Candy Sesh XT Evo’s! Better quality for less than half the price! The old Sesh’s sucked, but the XTs last for 5hrs and the case lasts for like 24hrs. I had a flight to Vegas with a layover, I didn’t charge them once and I listened to music the entire time. They also have great bass and volume and work really well for phone calls. I’ve used people’s AirPods and I was not impressed with the low quality of them for how ridiculously expensive they are. Then I found the Sesh XT Evo’s and I don’t think I’ll ever buy anything from overpriced Apple! The only reason I have an iPhone is because my sister gave me this phone for free when she switched carriers.

They are not the top of the line wireless headphones for sound quality and features, if that is what you're looking for, but perfect for my daily use.

It is a poor design on the part of Apple and I would not recommend this product to anyone. Apple is slipping and it shows in their products.

Title: Only last a handful of months before problems.
Review: I use these for high intensity, sweaty exercise almost every day. I’ve bought these twice. They are great for a few months and then quickly deteriorate to the point where one or both will not charge. You think they are charging based on the indicator light but you’ll be disappointed to find one didn’t connect and charge up. Then, there’s a feature where when you flip open the lid case, a dialogue box pops open on your iPhone and displays the charging levels of each AirPod and the case. That feature will begin to stop working over time as well for no apparent reason. I would not spend so much money on these and go with a half price competitor if I can’t expect these to last more than 4-5 months.

Title: Almost seamless integration
Review: I'm cheap. This was in large part why I resisted shelling out the money for these. Consequently, I tried several other Bluetooth earbuds, several on the decidedly cheap end of the scale. One of the problems I experience is finding earbuds that fit my ears. I have very small ear canals, so the earbuds that have the cone shape tip that fits into the ear canal either just won't fit, or are extremely painful after a short time. The only shape I've found that actually works for me are these, which I discovered with the first pair of wired Apple earbuds that came with a new iPhone several versions back.I included this picture, which shows the Airpods on the left and the much cheaper knock-off I tried. I thought I'd be okay with the shape of the cheap ones, but as you can see, they are actually much larger than the Airpods, so they were frequently falling out of my ears, especially when I was doing any physical activity.So, I bit the bullet and shelled out for the OGs. Here's my take:Pros:-Integration with other Apple products. I have an iPhone, iPad and Apple watch and these work quite seamlessly unlike any others I've tried. I put "almost" in the title because I'm sure it will be improved on in further versions, I'm just not sure how. Oh, and I've never used "Hey Siri" as much as I do with these. I love being able to adjust the volume (among other commands) hands free. True story: Yesterday I was riding a scooter home from work, and not wanting to remove either hand from the handlebars, I wanted to use Siri to increase the volume. There was enough ambient downtown noise that Siri was having trouble hearing me, so as I was tootling down the busy city street I was saying "Hey Siri" repeatedly at increasing volume, until I was shouting it. Not one of my finer moments...-The fit (see above)-Quick charging. I will have something to say about the battery life in Cons, but one saving grace is that they charge remarkably fast. I do a lot of work from my computer (like a lot of others during the time of COVID), so I appreciate being able to get a quick charge on them between meetings.-Sound quality. I am not an audiophile, so my opinion here is very pedestrian, but they seem to have a good dynamic range. I've been blown away by the bass response coming out of such a small thing.Cons:-They still are not very secure in my ears. I suppose that could be more my issue than the Airpods, but I did have to buy an aftermarket accessory kit that included the silicone tips with wings and a silicone lanyard. Sometimes I commute to work on an electric scooter, and if it weren't for those (particularly the lanyard) I would have dropped one of them in the street multiple times. Sometimes I walk over a grate in the street and have a brief moment of fear that one will pop out of my ear and through the grate. With my luck, it isn't so much an issue of "if", but "when". (Side Note: if Apple doesn't sell replacements individually, they should)-Battery life. I figure I get about 2 hours of active use, which is fine and I think what they advertise. The curious thing is that the two discharge at very different rates. I'm trying to keep track so I can take them into our local Apple store and ask about it, but it is odd, and I have seen other reviews that also noted that issue.Overall, I give them 2 thumbs up!

Title: Use them more than I thought I would. Falling out is an issue.
Review: I am using these more than I thought I would after a year, but it's more for at home or work listening and less active listening as they fall out too easily from my ears. I've had some mad under the plane seat scrambling when they fell out often on plane journeys and now in these COVID times I want to avoid that.I have some other Bang and Olufsen Beoplay wireless earbuds that are double the price of Airpods and their sound is wonderful, they are also noise canceling and fit better in the ears. But I use the AirPods a bit more everywhere due to the seamless pairing with iPhone or iPad without having to open up settings. The bass is punchier on Airpods compared to B&O although the overall sound is better on B&O. The one issue I had at work was the no one could see the black B&O earbuds in my ears and they would start speaking to me and I had no clue as they were noise cancelling. Airpods are much more visible in my ears. The one thing I did like about B&O earbuds that you could just tap them to turn of noise canceling and then it magnified the sounds around you, so I could even hear conversations further away. These Airpods have some degree of noise cancellation but not a whole lot.I wish the fit was better for more active situations. I constantly drop them if I put them on in the gym so I just use wireless earphones with a neckband. But they are ok at home if I just want to chat with someone on the phone and don't want them to hear external noises if I am cooking. They're also good for bed when I want to listen to some meditations before going to sleep but don't want to wake anyone. I bought them on a whim and have used them quite a bit. They burn my ears after an hour or two so I can't wear them for prolonged periods. For a more comfortable fit for long journeys I bring my Bang and Olufsen Beoplays. For the gym I bring along cheap $40 wireless earbuds that have a pumped up base and sound good for the gym.Overall, I will say that for the price they offer good sound and value.

Title: Exactly as Advertised -  Great Product and Service - Apple and Amazon, you've done it again!
Review: I ordered the APPLE AirPods  with Charging Case (without noise cancelling feature) on a Saturday night along with one other item that I normally get. The orders arrived Monday afternoon (Labor Day) together in a sealed Amazon box on my doorstep, a day earlier than promised. These AirPods are the real Apple (made in Vietnam) product and came sealed in their APPLE certified packaging with warrantee papers (1 year) and instructions. I paired and tested the AirPods with both my iPhone and my Windows 10 PC - easy to figure out based on the instructions included. Great high fidelity sound quality and they are so comfortable, I forget about them. I walk most days while listening to NPR news radio or Amazon music. I also watch news and movies on my PC in my room on Apple wired earphones - but I think I'll switch to using the AirPods from now on. These are perfect for my needs. And they were offered at a reduced price on Amazon. Thank you, APPLE. Thank you, Amazon.

Title: BEST PURCHASE YET on amazon. How did I live without these for so long.
Review: Been waiting and contemplating for a long time on whether to spend more than $100 on wireless AirPods. After tripping on my headphone cable and having my phone almost fall into a creek, I decided to take the leap. DEFINITELY WORTH EVERY DIME. Battery life is incredible. Even more incredible is the time the AirPods take to recharge once you put them to charge in the charged case. Holy super speed charging. It literally feels like it takes less than 2 to 3 minutes to charge them from 10% to 100%. Best product I have purchased on Amazon so far. Also, I would highly recommend buying a case for your AirPods as soon as you get them. I chose the cartoon looking deadpool and I couldn’t be happier.

Title: So happy with my purchase!
Review: Just received my new pair. I had a pair of AirPods but unfortunately left them in my pants pocket..and they went through a wash cycle. So I went on amazon to see about buying a new pair. My old pair was free (since I got a new iPad through Apple) but this pair was $136 with tax. I was definitely hesitant to buy these from amazon because of some of the reviews but I’m here to say these are AWESOME. They are legit Apple AirPods and they’re cheaper on amazon! The one on the left is my old pair and the new ones are on the right. There is no difference. Take it from me, you won’t regret it. Just make sure to check your pockets ALWAYS. They are not water proof and the advice Apple gave me did not work for the old ones (leave it out for 24 hours). Good investment if you listen to music a lot, make calls, like the convenience of no cords. Just be careful because it’s a lot of money to lose if you have no AppleCare. Even with AppleCare there are still fees to replace them.

Title: The Left Ear Bud is not working

I am very disappointed since I purchased a qty. 2 of over $300 (+) dollars.

Title: Good product and worth the price
Review: I needed some wireless headphones and I am worried about the cheaper wireless headsets. So I went with a product I know would check most of the boxes. They have good sound quality. You can change what tapping the headphones do which is awesome. But also at my work, if someone is trying to talk to me, I can take an ear bud out and it pauses what is playing and as soon as I put the headphone back in, it plays what I was playing. I have an iPhone 11 Pro and these have worked perfectly.

I REPEAT VERIFY WITH APPLE!!!😡

Title: Great buy

Title: Stopped working after a month!

And of course the window for returns was only 30 days so basically I spent all that money for a product that I maybe used 20 times. Save your money and just go to Target or AT&T. Or better yet spend a little more at the Apple store. At least there you get a 90 day warranty.

Title: Fantastic authentic Apple product.
Review: Sound quality is excellent. Paired instantly with my iPhone 11. This technology is remarkable. I bought this from amazon warehouse. It was unopened in excellent condition. Works perfectly with my refurbished iPhone 11 from amazon which was also in excellent condition. Thanks

Title: Great Quality

Title: Amazing!!!
Review: I was really on the fence whether or not to get these and I can say I am incredibly happy with my purchase I use them every day both at work For business meetings and at home listening to Spotify while cooking dinner and they have never fail to amaze! I found out I could hook them up to my television via Bluetooth as well so I can have the experience of walking in the door after work turning on the TV and it immediately starts playing on the AirPods that are already in my ears.

Title: Very bad mic quality
Review: Checked the serial number on Apple’s website and it says these are legit. But wonder if I got some counterfeits. Why do people say these are so good. The audio quality is horrible compared to the plug in airbuds that you get with your iPhone. And the voice quality is abysmal. I got these specifically for Zoom and Teams calls on my Mac book and people say they can barely hear me. I make calls from my iPhone XS with these and the same issue. I got on sale for $130 but that is till to much for these useless headphones.  Going back to the free plug in ear buds.  Also, they say 5 hours of battery life. But if you use for talk you only get 2 hours. I am in meetings all day. Useless.

Title: These are used Airpods
Review: I can't comment on whether these are authentic as some other people were wondering in their comments but I can say that the pair I received was used.  When I first connected them to my phone they connected as "Big _______ Juan's Airpods".  I won't write what the word is that I left out but I guess Juan was proud of himself...I can't see anywhere in the listing that it says that these Airpods were used so that is pretty frustrating.  Are they all refurbished?  Just feel misled.

Title: Air pods won't connect
Review: The most horrible experience, I bought these for my girlfriend and she was excited to try them and then I tried to pair them to her phone and they wont connect at all or even show up the animation screen of the airpods on her i phone, i looked up online and it said that the previous user has to forget the device from their phone in order to pair to a new phone, and we can not or Amazon contact the pervious user to get that done, so when asked for my options, I could of eaither get a replacement which I'm hoping won't be the same thing or a refund but I have to send back the headphones but I don't have much time due to work at the moment, so that is what I'm stuck with unfortunately so I just asked for a replacement at the moment, so disappointed in this product

Title: Pieces of junk
Review: Didn’t even last 2 years. Battery case went out in less than a year after purchase. Apple store replaced the case since it was within the 1 year warranty, about 5 months later the left pod died.  Shortly after the right one. Don’t waste your money, unless you get the Apple Care for 2 years, you’d have to shell out $90 to have either pod replaced, glad I didn’t since the right one died so soon after the left one did. Pieces of junk!!

I also like the fact that the outer case holds a charge and it doesn’t drain fast at all and then it charges them when you put them back in. They fit perfectly in my ears. I have not dropped them or have them fall out while doing things such as cleaning or doing anything physical.

Title: Very unreliable
Review: After the first 3 months or so, I had continual problems. One earbud wouldn't charge, issues connecting even after restarting. One day they would be working fine then the next morning I'd find that even though being plugged in all night, neither the case nor the buds had charged.

Title: Amazon did not honor free music trial and buds not suitable for gardening
Review: This is obviously a great product to use when on the phone. However, I was tempted by these to listen to music whilst weeding without having to carry the iphone around.  I should have done more research.  The range is a few feet, farther than that and the music just cuts in and out.  The buds also don't stay in my ears as I move.  Back to the shuffle and headphones I guess.  My biggest gripe was that I never received the e-mail to start a free music trial. I contacted Amazon three different times and their customer service was awful. They claimed they couldn't see the deal on the product page-even had me send screen shots to prove it.  Made me feel like I was lying to them.  The deal is still there!!  They never got back to me.

Title: They work for a little But not long
Review: I had them for maybe two months and now they disconnect randomly and don’t produce any sound extremely upset at the quality

Title: What's there to say?
Review: I waited to review this product until I had had them for a while so I could assess their longevity. These airpods have been glued to my ears for the past 13 months or so. I would conservatively estimate that I use them for at least 30 hours a week. They've lasted me through countless Zoom meetings, long walks through the park, and study sessions. Even though I'm one of those people who's a total sucker for Apple products, it took me a while to bite the bullet and get these. My advice: do it! I haven't regretted it.

Title: Very frustrating to use

Im sure im a special case here, but my airpods very often will not work, they pair just fine but will very often randomly disconnect or not play any sound. Sometimes only one will work. Sound quality is pretty decent, battery is good but the actual case is always dead it seems. This is by far the most frustrating product ive spent money on in terms of technology. I will be changing to either the airpods pro or a set of Sony headphones.

Title: Worth it!

Title: A little disappointed but it turned out okay in the end.
Review: Unfortunately, I had to request a refund because the AirPods would not connect to any of my devices. I thought that I could save a few bucks by purchasing the AirPods that were used but in good condition as they were supposed to be verified to work but this wasn’t the case. I ended up requesting a refund on the used pair and ordering AirPods that were brand new on the same night. The brand new pair worked great. Fortunately, even if you buy the “used in good condition” ones that are verified by the seller and they do not work the return/refund process was very easy.

These not ‘noise canceling’ ear buds but at medium volume they are great for sitting in the office for long calls or Great for hands free driving.

Title: Airpods are Great But...
Review: These were fantastic and a game changer for me for the first few months. But the left pod stopped working recently. I've tried everything. From checking out message boards online to reading other reviews and looking for similar issues. It was a quick progression. First it took a while for the left to connect. Then it just stopped working no matter what. Shows up as green, 100% battery but still no sound ever comes out of it. Otherwise, I'd recommend AirPods to anyone with Apple devices as they are smart, sleek and convenient. Guess I just got a bad individual product. Probably should have gone directly through Apple for something like this just to be safe.

Title: All around gets the job done, but dies out
Review: It’s ok in the beginning. Although even from the start there is no noise cancellation not even passive noise canceling (ear buds) and they slip out if you have them on for a few hours. The sound quality to me is ok I guess? It does sound good but not exactly great. But the main problem with these truly witless earbuds is that they lose sound after only about three months of having them. I try my hardest to keep my ears clean while having them in and I also kinda quickly clean them afterwards with like my shirt but they are so silent now I can’t even take them to the gym. Although they’re mostly meant for casual use they are supposed to withstand light drops of water and easily bare earwax. So honestly try spending a bit more for something more worth while and will last longer

Title: Authentic Product, but Wildly Overrated
Review: If I hadn't authenticated the serial number, I'd seriously think I was sold a counterfeit product.  Since this is an authentic, new product, I'm just left to believe the product is mediocre at best.I regularly use my air pods on both iOS and Android devices. The air pods connect relatively quickly and easily to both, but especially with other Apple devices. (For some reason, the max volume is significantly lower on my Android device.) The Bluetooth range is not great with reception starting to break up if you move more than 4-5' away from the phone.  The sound is pretty clear, but less than 10 weeks after purchase, individual ear buds will cut in and out or get static-y even while sitting stationary next to my phone.  Like other reviewers, my individual ear buds don't seem to charge evenly with one often dying well before the second.  I've also been disappointed with the battery performance. The ear buds re-charge quickly when inserted into the case and I'd say I can probably get 5 hours of run time between charges of the *case*, but I struggle to regularly get more than 2 hours of run time per full charge of the ear buds (and oftentimes not even that).  Finally, I have no idea how people wear these all the time as I found the shape of the air pods to be tremendously uncomfortable.  (Though I am aware accessories exist to mitigate this issue)I truly don't understand the effuse praise heaped upon air pods. I am deeply underwhelmed.

Title: Okay, but overpriced. Buy from a different brand.
Review: These are definitely overpriced for the sound quality and battery you get. Plus issues are fairly common with Apple products.ProsDecent sound qualityComfortable in earsCharges very quicklyDecent battery lifeConsOverpriced (it’s Apple so no surprise)Loses battery out of case with no audioBluetooth pairing is hit or miss occasionallyAlso, the right AirPod has trouble charging in the case. The problem with Apple is that when they announce or publish new technology, the older versions are lower in quality on purpose. For example, with AirPods pro released, now the previous version of AirPods are low in quality and break easier. I have to insert it in the slot several times to make the light orange (indicating it’s charging).I’ve treated them fairly well as I should, but this comes down to a technical issue that Apple fails to respond to because they slow/corrupt older software to get people to upgrade.I wouldn’t recommend this version of AirPods since the pro version exists. You’ll probably run into an issue within 6 months. I’d switch to a different brand. Some Youtube videos show which brands to check out and to avoid.

It's nice to not have to hassle with cords at the gym.

Title: My Take: Knockoffs Aren’t Apple AirPods’ for Less $$
Review: I have only had the AirPods for a few days but for those of you who have wondered if any of the knock offs are comparable to the Apple AirPods, my answer is that at least the one I tried is not. The charging case and earbuds look almost identical to the Apple AirPods,  but that’s where the similarities end. The knock-off’s earbuds  don’t fit the ear the same way and fall out easily,  the connection between the iPhone and the earbuds is spotty, the battery life is not anywhere near what the AirPods offer, and controlling the knockoff is a nightmare. If you’re waffling about spending the money and you really want excellent sound quality and the rest of the differences, spend it. Yes they are priced higher than I wish they were, but the difference is worth it, at least from my perspective.

Title: These work well

It's held charge well. I have an Android phone and it connects well. It changes between my phone and computer decently also. Oh, they're also comfortable. My other pair would hurt my ear. These don't. I've only used them for calls and the computer. I haven't tried running with them. They stay in my ear and don't move around and don't hurt.

I was so happy with this purchase, that I bought another set for my husband and one for my daughter. Highly recommends!

Title: A Gym MUST
Review: I’ve been in the market for new Bluetooth headphones for awhile while workingout. The ones I used were large, fell off easy, and would get in the way while lifting weights.I need something that wouldn’t destroy the bank, had a long battery life, and would stay in my ears while laying on a bench or pressing weights above my head.They connected to my phone with no issue after opening, the charger and booklet looked good as new.I highly suggest this to anybody looking for new headphones while at the gym, my only suggestion is to clean them after use if you sweat a lot to ensure they stay in good condition (though it isn’t necessary).You’ll need to charge fairly often though, after a new hour session, I find that the charging box will be about 50-60% battery.Hope this helps someone!

Title: Planned Obsolescence. Evil Apple
Review: I never liked the idea of Apple getting rid of the headphone jack but never knew why.Now I know. It wasn't to make space for more tech in the phone. It was to boost the sales of Bluetooth headphones. And it worked. Apple made a lot of money.I got mine and I really liked them. I also have 100 dollar wired earphones. I've had them both for about 3 years. The airpods no longer have a 4 hour battery. It has a 1 one hour battery per charge. I called apple to ask about getting a replacement. They said it was 70 bucks per airpod. I said, I might as well buy a new pair.That's when it hit me. Apple is making money with the increase in sales for Bluetooth headphones but ALSO insuring that people will come back to buy more when the battery no longer holds a charge. They know this. I don't know about you, but if I pay over 100 dollars for some headphones. I want it to last more than 3 years. My wired earphones work like the day I bought them.This is diabolically evil of APPLE.I AM TELLING YOU THIS AS A WARNING. IF YOU BUY BLUETOOTH HEADOHONES, BE PREPARED TO BUY A NEW SET IN 2-3 YEARS BECAUSE THE BATTERY WILL INEVITABLY DIE.

Title: Great for music and calls, not so much for online meetings.
Review: I love the convenience of and ease of airpods. I am almost always using them for listening to music or watching videos on my macbook. Mic can be a hit or miss depending on where I am and how I am using it. For phone calls in quite settings, it's good. For outdoors, not so much. What disappoint me completely is that that it is a fail when taking online calls or video conferencing. My sound is always muffled for others and there is a lag between the video and the sound. I have yet to find a bluetooth earphone that works best for online calls. Apple needs to improve their game when it comes to mic. Maybe better than many, but not the best. With over a $100 price point I expected more.  Overall, neat product if you will use it for occasional phone calls and music.

Title: Did not last more than 6 months.  Constantly fall out of my ears.
Review: Mixed feelings on this item.  I have a pair that I have had for about a year and a half that still work well.  I only use them a few times a week, but other than the fact that they constantly fall out of my ears, I like them.  If I wasn't able to find the aftermarket silicone ear hooks that I need to use to keep them from falling out all the time, I would have returned them and give them a 1 star rating.  To be fair, I have small ears.  So, I would consider another option if you have small ears.  That said, this review is for a second pair I bought as a gift.  Unfortunately, after 6 months the right pod would not charge/work at all.  The left one would work, but only for about 20 min.  If fully charged and left in the charging case, both the case and the working pod would completely drain, which implies the batteries are not good in the case or the pod(s).  The person I bought these for didn't tell me about the problems until several months after she noticed it.  So, I had her give them to me and contacted Apple.  Support was really good and they tried to help me get them to work over the phone.  Unfortunately, no luck.  So, I asked what my options were to get them replaced or fixed.  They said they were out of warrantee and it would cost over $200 +$12 S&H to get them repaired.  I paid under $150 for them, so naturally all I could say was thanks for the help...  I guess I'll just throw these in the trash.  There are a lot of options out there that are a lot less pricy.  So, I will replace the gift, since I don't like to give a gift that is defective.  However, I may look at the Samsung or a couple of others that are out there.  Again, the ones I own still work fine.  This pair was obviously just a "lemon", but since Apple wasn't willing to do anything, I have a bad taste in my mouth.  Pretty disappointed with Apple.  Such good service, but won't stand behind their products.  Don't even get me started about the easy-break glass on their phones and pads.

Title: Make sure you keep track of the serial number
Review: I was using my AirPods on a work call at the grocery store and the AirPod case accidentally fell out of my pocket. I was unable to find it and when I contacted Apple to replace the case, they informed me that I needed the serial number, which is written on the case, to replace the case. The serial number wasn't on the invoice from Amazon and so unfortunately, I'll have to purchase an entire new set of headphones. Frustrating experience. Lesson: either make sure you don't lose the case or make sure you have the serial number saved someplace.

Title: My life is complete now!
Review: Greatest earphones ever!I don’t know how I ever lived without these, seriously, not just the earphones but the great little case that they come in that charges your ear buds even when it’s not plugged in so perfect to have when you’re traveling.The ear buds not only allow you you to  call people by simply saying “hey Siri” but it answers any questions, it reads and composed text messages if I ask, it plays music etc. etc.  Simply ask and you shall receive.I can now cook with my hands full while dancing to the beat of any song I ask Siri to play, ask Siri to take notes for me or even help give me recipe ideas.Once you’ve used these you will also ask yourself how you ever lived without it as it makes your life so much easier.The sound is fantastic  along with the noise reduction and whomever I’m speaking with hears me well.These are pricey but I assure you they are worth every penny you pay.

Title: They're OK. I wish I bought them elsewhere though.
Review: I was hesitant to purchase Airpods because of the steep price so when I saw there was a deal a few months ago (early 2020) I hopped on the bandwagon! Since I have many Apple products, these DO make it easier to sync up to my Macbook, iPhone and iPad. However, even with that being the case the airpods I received were defective. I spent hours talking to customer service and at the Apple Store (pre-COVID) and they ended up having to replace the case and one of the airpods. At times I still have issues with connectivity and the microphone isn't the greatest. Sometimes my airpods would be in the case and I wasn't trying to connect to my phone yet the music would play WHILE THEY WERE IN THE CASE. I even reported this to the apple care team and my customer service representative told me it was something they'd never seen or heard about before. (Seriously wish I was making this up, I just wanted to be able to have wireless earbuds).I'll admit that I don't fully regret my purchase, but regret buying it via Amazon instead of from the Apple Store or a major retailer (i.e. Best Buy). Not sure if my logic makes sense, but I feel like there would've have been less of a chance of getting a faulty item.TLR; Airpods aren't a bad investment, but be wary and monitor your item if you buy it via Amazon. ALSO they aren't noise cancelling and the microphone isn't the greatest. The sound is OK but if you want to still spend a good amount of money, you probably can get better quality headphones elsewhere. The best feature to me is that it is super connected with my apple products and I can tap to change the songs, etc.

Title: E
Review: This product is shoddy. There is so much break in sounds it is ridiculous. I am better offUsing the regular wired headset. I tried everything including charging the Apple  AirPods overnight thinking that may be the problem. Of course to no avail. I got tired of  the pods that I left them  on the shelf. Of course when I called Amazon, they called Apple and referred me to Apple Customer Service instead. Sorry I bought this poor quality product. I may have been better off with Chinese “ knock off” version, if such is on the market

Title: Best Earbuds I’ve ever Owned - beats Bose

I have two pair of Bose earbuds that I really like but I was shocked at how good these AirPods sounded. I heard instruments I’d not heard before. Better stereo separation and great deep but articulated bass.And they run for hours, handle voice commands perfectly and are great in my office for phone work. And they literally recharge to 100% in 15 minutesThese are the best sonic and overall earbuds I’ve ever owned.

Title: These things are pretty great
Review: I love being able to throw these things in my pocket. I felt they looked a little goofy at first, but I got over that. They don't advertise these ones as noise cancelling, but I swear they do cancel out some of the outside noise, and I don't think that's just in my head, either. They aren't cheap, but I have a pair of these and a pair of Beats Studio Earphones, and that way I can go either way, which usually means I use the AirPods for walks, or going out, and the Earphones are for the beach, or at home (is it just me or is it just a little scary being basically deaf to the world around you at times?)I think they ought to include these with the purchase of the expensive phones that Apple sells, but that's just me.One last thing-supposedly the newer generation are more sweat resistant than these ones, but I haven't had any issues there, so I'm not sure what that's all about. It's not like I'm a marathon runner, but I have worn these in the summer on long walks, and besides cleaning them with a q-tip here and there, there's no issues.The battery life is about 2 hours, maybe a hair less than that, but if you just bring the case with you, you put them back in there and about 15-20 minutes later they're charged again. The case itself needs to be charged every so often, which roughly translates to every 2-3 days, or every 3 charges. They last a long time if they're just sitting in the drawer, not on the charger, which makes them available to use pretty much at all times. As the corny cliche goes, I don't leave home without them.

Title: Love them!
Review: Absolutely love these!  Like others, I wish I hadn’t waited so long to buy them. They’ve improved my quality of life. I can now watch shows late at night without being worried about the neighbors complaining (I’m also a bit hard of hearing.) They have allowed me the flexibility to crank up the music while I’m cooking or cleaning. I can get lots more done and still enjoy the music. They help me understand the instructions in my yoga class as the sound is more consistent when I’m (or the instructor) are in different positions. They stay in place and recharge quickly. Even when I’m recharging my device, I can use the AirPod to listen to a program, ebook, music or whatever before falling sleeping and the next morning everything is good to go. Easy to set up with my other devices and that’s really saying something from me 😁.

Title: Water proof tested!
Review: I received these Apple Ear pods this past Sunday and charged them overnight to start using them Monday around the house. I was in my backyard servicing my Koi pond when the left ear pod feel out of my ear as I watched in horror straight to the bottom. it didn't float for a second, straight down. I reached down retrieving it and immediately dried it off. I thought @*%$# just wasted $134 in my Koi pond!!! I blew out any external moisture there was and gave it a rice bath for about 24hrs. This morning gave it a charge in its case, then paired it with my iPhone SE and Sirius XM sounds perfect! No residual damage from its visit with my Koi. Amazing!

Title: Does NOT Last
Review: At first I really liked them. They stay in my ears and didn't hurt that much, and the battery life seemed to last for a long time. I've had them for about 6 months now though and they have stopped working the way they are supposed to. When I want to use them I have to fiddle with them a lot to get them to work and most of the time only one ear bud is charged. They don't pop up on my phone when I'm trying to see how charged they are and when they are charging only one of them is charging at a time. I don't know what to do because it seems like a total waste of money to buy Airpods for $130 for them to only last 6 months. Now I'm looking into buying new wireless earbuds but I'm definitely not going to be buy Airpods again. :(

Title: Please beware the Amazon / Apple cheats you out of warrenty

They  told us that they cannot honor the warrenty to get it repaired as they consider the Order date as Warrenty, I wish I would have gove to a  physical store to buy  . Title: Great to certain level..... Read why!
Review: Let me began, I hate apple products with passion, BUT I was tired of people complaining about (my voice) not being able to hear me due to background noise on my Rowkin earbuds picks up(amazing for music specially under motorcycle helmet).Bought the Airpods for my android Oneplus 6T 🤘 and it took a minute or less to sync, impressed with Apple for not making these just for their own devices.Hasn't used them enough to talk about comfort level or battery.They are in OEM box/packaging, and the serial no checks out for warranty.Pros,Sound quality is good in my ears and I still care hear my surroundings (good for work and walking in Street where you need to be alert).Price is within range of other good quality earbuds.Case is cool and the feature they sit standby and connect immediately once airbuds are out of caseCons,Doesn't feel secure in my ears, although haven't fall out yet.Apple proprietary charger, catch up Apple, USB C!!!Android doesn't show battery level, does for other Bluetooth devices but not Airpods, there are apps work great.The volume is low for music, but great for phone/video calls(primary reason I bought these for).Do I recommend it? Absolutely if you talk on the phone alot.If this review was useful to you, please follow me for more reviews. Thanks!

Title: InstantConnectivity
Review: Music is my game, and I love to listen to my favorite music on a high noise level. No worries about bothering the neighbors, now. I purchased these from Amazon at a one time discount, a little nervous that I would not receive the quality. No worries, noise cancellation, perfect, quality of sound, excellent, ease of use , very easy.These arrived in a tight pa kati g as all of App'e products do. Once I got in and read the directions, it was very easy. The pods were at different levels of battery life,so I plugged them in. Both at 100% within a short period of time. The bBluetooth was turned on, instantly the ear pics were connected. I put them in my ears, and started listening to the new Rufus Wainwright’s CD, ‘Unfollw The Rules’. Beautiful music and Rufus’s voice came through. I am quite happy with these ear pods.Recommended. prisrob 07-31-2020

Title: Good deal
Review: Battery life is fantastic, product has a nice weight to it, feels very solid. The earbuds have tons of volume, decent amount of bass but nothing crazy, I personally think they are lacking in the vocals though. Tried a variety of songs and the vocals just sound the tiniest bit dampened behind the rest of the music, just not as crisp and clear as it should be. Over all great earbuds for the price, well worth it to not cheap out on.

Title: Worth the price!!

She doesn’t leave the house without them!! I’m currently a college student with one as well and I really think it’s a great investment. Worth the price!! The battery life on it is also really good and I sometimes go days without charging.

Title: Don't waste your money like I did, buy some Beat Pro's.
Review: AirPods are over hyped, one of my worst buy that I ever made and here is my reason why.1st- didn't not charge correctly-one side will charge to 100% and the other side would be at 2%. I tried everything in the book/youtube to make this work and nothing. It charge at 100% when it wanted to. This would hurt my workout times and had me super upset2nd- sounds quality was horrible, wasn't loud at all and I could hear what was going on in the background. It just sucked3rd- would fallout of my ears easily, any small bump and they're it went.4th-waste of moneyThe only good thing that came out of this is that I'm now a proud owner of Beats Pro's. They worth every cent and I haven't had to go through any of the issues that I had with the AirPods.

Title: Short life span
Review: These started out great. Paired good and worked right out of the box easy.Granted I work on a construction site so they take a little more abuse.After only a few months it seems like the battery life has shortened.I can get maybe a solid 3.5 hours out of them.Then there is the right AirPod issue.Constantly it won’t take a charge unless you reset.Constantly I pop them in the case and go to use them later and the right one would not charge unless reset.Now currently if paused for a while it disconnects and I have to go in to settings and reconnect. Big let down for only having these roughly 7 months, paying 150$ for mediocre long term quality. That’s Apple for you

Title: Best purchases ever!!!

Title: very light headset with rock solid sound quality!!
Review: Although I am huge Apple fan, I was initially skeptical about buying Apple AirPods. I already had a different brand bluetooth headset (which was so-so) and for some reason I didn't have high expectations of AirPods. But these AirPods really beat my expectations. They are light, easily chargeable and have solid sound quality. I mainly use it for business calls from iPhone, and this is just magic! Crystal clear quality, like snowflakes in my ears. I wish I got them earlier!! The only drawback is a bit weird way to check case charge level. You need to open the case in proximity to your iPhone with AirPods in. I find this strange, I wish there was easier and more streamlined way to check it. At any rate, this is a great product and I do recommend it to Apple fans!

Title: I'm glad I bit the bullet, and purchased the real deal instead of knockoffs.
Review: I've purchased 3 different knockoffs, and each one was terrible. I "bit the bullet", spent the mega amount of money for the "cadillac" brand, and am satisfied with the generation one airpods. Unlike the knockoffs, these earbuds don't drop connection, and stay synced with one another. If you're like me, and are hesitant because of the amount of money the apple brand cost, you'll get more for your money buying the official brand. I've spent the same amount collectively on the three other "airpods" being $130 instead of buying these in the first place. Now, if we're to look at it like this, in the end I've spent $260 😥 I would include a picture of the airpods, but anyone reading this can just as easily google image search 'apple airpods generation one". What I received is exactly as described.

Title: Great Apple product

Title: If You Don't Dig In-Ear Silicone, These are Awesome
Review: I'm the first to be an Apple Griever where applicable (f*** that iphone notch!), but these pods are phenomenal and I could not be happier with them. I'd go even as far to agree they're "magical".Remember when you were a kid with your snaz ipod/mp3 player and those ol' wired headphones? You would think, "golly gosh, how cool would it be if these headphones had NO CORDS and just somehow PLAYED JAMS in my DOME?"Well the future of my ruddy-cheeked boyhood dreams is here, and there is something undeniably neat about the buds vanishing on the sides of your ears without a detectable trace from a head swivel.All this can be said about any truly wireless buds though. What I personally like about these is what many don't prefer: their airy non-sealed fit.I've already got big noise-cancelling cans to put over the ears for hardcore music seshes and studio/field work. I wanted an alternative for biking, walking, and for just sort of existing with the addition of quality background music.These don't seal off your ability to hear like airpod pros and almost every other earbud on the market, so you could listen to tunes and also talk to friends simultaneously without the need of "passive mode".I also plan on using these for phone calls quite often, and if you've tried doing such with silicon in-ear buds it's like trying to talk to someone with your fingers plugged into your head (like you're talking underwater lol)This design does take away from bass and punchy sound capabilities of in-ear models, but that said sound quality is still terrific on these. Mids and Highs are especially nice and clear and there's still a good amount of fullness noticeably better than the traditional wired apple earpods.And the freaking case is absolute fidget-toy evocative of eMacs and white Macbooks remembered fondly.All said I am late but absolutely on the airpod bandwagon, and if you don't like the ear-plunger style of earphones save yourself some money and get these!

Title: Very dissatisfied

Title: Amazing as a hands-free.
Review: Bought these as a hands-free with intent to mostly use only one earpiece. Partly because my ears are clearly a bit different and while right bud sits tight, the other one falls out almost immediately while on the move. But the one that doesn't fills like it was made for that ear. Nice, snug and comfortable. It doesn't even make any attempts to fall out. Almost every aspect is perfect for what they were bought. Sound quality, distance (from iPhone), battery life, size, weight, ergonomics. My only complaint is price ofc. This can be said about all Apple products.Never intended to use them for music for obvious reasons, but I must say I expected them to sound way worse, than they do. For an average Joe they sound very decent. Still if you value sound quality, I would look elsewhere. These are clearly not for music enthusiasts.Bottom line. If you need earbuds for your iPhone mostly for the phone calls and occasionally to listen the music, look no further. Taken they will hold in your ears nice an snug, which I suggest you to find out before buying them.

Title: Like the Airpod 2 since you can hear around you
Review: These Airpods have good sound quality and the microphone functions well for conference calls and video conferencing.  Good noise cancelation of backgound noise which improves how others hear you during a call.  I like the open-ear design so you can hear what's going on around you.  The downside is battery life during a call is only 3 hours, much longer when listening to music.  My biggest complaint is these really only connect with one device at a time.  My other bluetooth devices connect with 2 or more devices simultaneously.  Therefore to change devices you have to force the connection and sometime when I start my computer it unexpectedly steals the connection.

Title: Phone microphone issue because other party can barely hear me
Review: After using these for about 2 weeks, the phone aspect no longer works properly.  The person on the other line will say that I sound like I'm 100 feet away when talking to them.  I bought these for work conference calls at home, so they're worthless to me now.  I bought them on May 22 and the return window closes on May 31 on Amazon, so if they work fine for 2 weeks and then break, you cannot return them.  I've googled my issue and there are tons and tons of people with the same problem.  Save you money here or buy them from Costco which has a much better return policy (without having to spend more money on a warranty).

Restocking fee? They were BROKEN. Amazon- this is shady and so unlike you. My daughter worked super hard to earn her money mowing lawns. You just made her mow four more lawns to rebuy the same headphones. Pretty rotten.

Title: Great product from Apple, What Mom says!!! 😂
Review: So my mom used to take my old Apple headphones all the time cause the fit comfortably for here was always a pain lol so she has been looking for a good pair of ear buds for a long time. She’s not a tech person at all, so I thought these would be great for her sense she always took my old pair.So for Mother’s Day I got her a pair, oh boy I hit it right on the money. She absolutely enjoys them 100%, she tells me every time I see her how great they are. She wears one at work, uses them doing outside chores, going for walks, listening to books and so much more. The sound quality is better that your old ones and being wireless is so much more productive in life. Haven’t heard a complaint about them so far, so I recommend them to anyone looking for a good pair of earbuds.

Title: Great Bluetooth earbuds but noise cancellation is limited.
Review: Love the AirPods, I’ve been using the same pair for two years now with no issues. Battery life is great and usually last me 4 days of 8 hour use at work, and they charge up in a matter of minutes! Sound quality is alright but doesn’t match earbuds that make a seal in your ear. My one complaint is that there is almost no sound cancellation and while working with machinery at work I have to turn the volume all the way up. So if you are looking for a earbud to block out ambient noise, look elsewhere or possibly get the AirPod pros. As for build quality these are amazing, I have never had any problems within the two years I’ve owned them. I even dropped them in a lake and they were completely fine (although they are not waterproof so don’t use them in wet applications).

Title: Happy I Bought Them
Review: Sound quality is good. I love how smoothly my AirPods synced up with my iPhone straight out of the box and pair immediately when I put them in my ears. There is not really any noise cancellation, but these do t really claim to so I don’t hold that against them. They are surprisingly comfortable to wear. I use them for work because I am on the phone my entire shift. The battery life is about 2 hours when talking on the phone before needing charged. I wish this was longer. Nice thing is I can take one out and have it charging then switch and charge the other, all without interrupting my calls. Really, only complaint is battery life, but I get it. They are small and wireless. Where would they store more energy? I’m sure that will improve with newer versions.

Title: EARS ARE NOT ONE SIZE FITS ALL, VERY VERY LIMITED BATTERY LIFE
Review: These ear pods are wonderful in quality of sound, ease of use.  I particularly like how you just lift it into your ear and it knows to switch.  I have not figured out how to answer and end a call without having to tap the phone, but haven’t looked it up.  Tapping the airpod activates the music and switches the song, which is nice, but I have to find out if I can stop music play.Downside:  Battery life is surprisingly and disappointingly brief.  I used them for a phone call that lasted about 1 1/2 hours.  The buds went dead before the call was finished!Ears are not one size fits all.  I must be careful when using them or they will fall out of my ear.  Having to pay an additional $100 for the “pro" model, which is supposed to have adjustable fittings, is a rip off.  It’s like buying a pair of shoes, advertised at $100.  “Oh, you want them in YOUR size?  Well, that will be an additional $100."  So, if purchasing these, beware of the fit.I will not recommend these or purchase again.

Title: Do Not Invest in These
Review: Do not waste your money on buying these. They are passive, which means you hear everything around you so no matter how high you turn up the volume, you'll be able to hear everything around you.The microphone is TERRIBLE. On video call meetings I get complaints that the audio is fuzzy when I talk and that I sound like a robot. Keep in mind these are paired to a brand new 2019 Apple MacBook Pro, so there should be no issues, yet there are. If these can't work with a product that the SAME manufacturer produces I can only imagine how bad they are if you're on PC.Battery life is also horrible, they die within a few hours of being charged and they get you with the gimmick that the case extends the battery life to over a day or something. Dont fall for this marketing ploy. Sad waste of ~$150. Wish I had bought something else.

Title: Unreliable, in my case :>(
Review: These were great for 5-3/4 months. Then the charging got wonky. Repeat whole process. Very disappointed in this product. Because of COVID, I can't take them into the local Apple Store. Instead, I get a $220 hold on my credit card, and wait for a refurb unit. I should have the hold removed once they get my defective unit back. I won't buy these again. If you do buy them, I strongly recommend the AppleCare (which you must buy within the first 60 days of placing your order.)

Title: Great pair of wireless headphones. If you're an iPhone user, get these.
Review: I have to be honest. I used to poke fun at these, and the people who wore them, every time I saw them. I never thought I’d actually own a pair. However, I had become very frustrated with the pairing capabilities of some cheaper wireless headphones I owned. Sometimes they would take a very long time to pair, other times they wouldn’t pair at all. It was even more difficult to pair them with my MacBook. I had watched video reviews and heard many positive things about the AirPods, especially their convenient fast pairing abilities. I had some extra $ lying around so I decided to purchase them. I was pleasantly surprised at how quickly they paired with my iPhone. Not only that but I could easily pair them with my Mac if I decided to switch. I’ve heard that Android users may want to look elsewhere in purchasing wireless headphones, but for iPhone users, I would say that these AirPods are the best way to go. Extreme audiophiles who care about sound quality the most won’t be blown away by how these sound, but if you’re looking for a convenient wireless headphone to use throughout your day, look no further than these.

Title: Great Apple product. Spend the big bucks or don't do it at all.
Review: Good sound, they fit in the ears and do NOT fall out like corded buds. The sound is good, but don't expect audiophile level sound. You can't expect any better than this from tiny little ear buds. But the essential element to these are the freedom to walk away from your source with NO wires, nothing. The freedom is the charm here. That and the apple name make this worth the investment. Sometimes I use these, and other times for real music listening I use full size headphones. But for videos, non serious music listening and whatever else, these are great. I would say it's better to spend the extra money and get the good stuff, than spend twenty or thirty bucks on some unknown product. Expensive, but as all else in life you either buy the real deal or you buy some cheap substitutes. Ain't worth it....It paired effortlessly with my iPhone seven and my older iPad four.I recommend genuine apple products.

Title: A must for Zoom classes
Review: I started teaching my yoga classes via zoom out of necessity.  I set up my iPad and everything worked great, except the sound.  I had to speak at full volume for anyone to hear me. It was exhausting. Then another teacher recommended these. I was hesitant to spend so much money hoping for a less costly solution. Finally gave these a try and I’m sorry it took so long.  I can have my head down in a pose demonstrating and talking and can be heard by everyone. Love them! And I use them for listening to music or movies too. Brilliant product

Title: Great earphones
Review: I've wanted headphones that fit on my ears while I run forever. Every pair I ever bought would fall off my ears. Maybe my ears are just weird, but these work perfect. They sound great too. Another thing I absolutely love about these is that they do not leak sound. I can listen to music as loud as I want at work, and the people one seat over can't hear it over their fan, which is great. Compare that to my last pair of headphones that leaked so much that everyone in my row could hear what I was listening too, and you have yourself a satisfied customer. I bought 3 pairs. One for gym, one for work, one for home.

Title: Great Bluetooth connection and battery life
Review: One of the best Apple purchases I’ve ever made.The AirPods sound quality is good. Not the best sound quality ever (compared to a pair of Bose headphones), but for its price, I found that the quality was great.The AirPods connect seamlessly and instantly to my iPhone, which was very important to me and made this purchase so great. The battery life is also very impressive. I listen to music and videos with my AirPod for about an hour a day, and I am able to go about four days (if not more) without charging.

Has anyone else encountered this problem? Other than that, theyve worked great for the past year.

Title: Just Found Out These Are Not Genuine Apple AirPods
Review: I just discovered after having these Airpods for many months that they are not genuine Apple AirPods. The serial number on the box does not match the serial number on the AirPods which does not match the serial number when I open my iphone and go to Settings>General>About and check the serial number. I kept wondering why these didn't quite feel the same in my ear as my first pair that I bought from Apple and later lost. Now I know. These are fake. Because I've had them since Sep 2019, I already know Amazon is going to do nothing.

Title: LOVE THEM
Review: I was debating on buying air pods for a long time now, but I finally caved and did it! I love these! They are so convenient! I can place in my ears and not have to worry about the device they are connected to or the cord. They do not cancel out that much background noise, but i typically only use them to listen to music or for classes on Zoom and for that they are fine. I will say the battery could last a little while longer, I have had to charge them halfway through my 4 hour zoom class even when they had a full charge. But other than that, I love them!!

Title: Dissapointed if Apple Airpods
Review: I bought my airpods on Feb. Didn't  use them until March because it was a present for my hubby, well now I was listening to them and the right air pod went dead. I figured, maybe I just need to charge them. So when I got home I charged them, and the next day I went to use them again and the right air bud was still dead.I put them to charge and when I went to retrive them from the case I notice the one with the issue was stuck and felt very hot, it overheated (melted)  and now it's  completed dead. Very dissapointed.I chatted with an Amazon customer service and explained the problem and he was a ble to assist me and said he would send a repacement and exchange the bad ones for some working airpods;He made my day. Thank you Amazon

Title: I see now what all the fuss is about
Review: I didn't originally want to spend the extra money for airpods, and had some other brand wireless bluetooth headphones. Those worked fine (until they stopped charging for no reason), but the airpods really do work so much better, especially if you have an iphone. Connecting them to the iphone takes seconds, you just hold the case next to your phone and open it. The sound quality is great. The automatic pausing when you take out one airpod is a great feature, and they have a pretty long range - I can leave my phone downstairs and still be connected. The battery life isn't the longest but they charge super quick so it's not a big deal. They're also really comfortable, I have weirdly small ears and I can wear these for hours without any pain or irritation.

Title: LOVE THEM!!
Review: To start off, these are 100% GENUINE. I confirmed the serial number on the Apple website. I even purchased a second pair a few weeks later and THOSE were legitimate too. I have no idea what to say about reviews claiming these are fake. If you buy these and get ones you believe are fake.....it’s a good thing Amazon has an awesome return policy! :DI love these sooo much!! When airpods first came out, I thought they were the most useless luxury and never saw myself buying them. It wasn’t until recently I became interested in airpods when normal wired earbuds were becoming extremely annoying during workouts. I decided to make the plunge and don’t regret it one bit.These are  sooo freeing and enjoyable to wear. Super convenient for working out and I can even walk all over the house without my phone and still be able to listen to things!I even bought a pair for my dad and he loves wearing them when working in the garden. He was never too bothered by wires but agrees that airpods are so nice because of how “freeing” they are.Because of the freedom airpods allot we find ourselves listening to way more music/videos/podcasts which is great for managing stress too.A+!!

Title: Uneven battery life
Review: These are my first airpods and they are quite convenient, and work well. My only gripe is that my right airpod consistently has less battery life than the left.I take them both out at the same time or I take the left one out first, so they have the same charge and use time. If the left is at 85%, the right will be around 75-80%. When the right airpod gives the warning low battery tone at 10%, the left will still be fine with 22% left. I've had them for a month and this battery life discrepancy has been consistent.

Title: Like most Apple products, they work well until they don't
Review: Disclaimer: I didn't want to get these. I would prefer to use wired earbuds.  But with the removal of the 3mm headphone jack in all iPhones, I can no longer simultaneously charge the phone and use the earbuds which is a huge problem.So I tried these, which work pretty well most of the time.  Audio quality is just ok - I am frequently having people on the line say "what?" because they can't hear me any time there is ambient background noise. A bigger annoyance is about 10% of the time when I answer the phone, the airpods just don't work - they don't pick up the call, but block the call from working on speaker or phone either, so both parties sit there saying "hello?" "hello?" "hello?" until somebody hangs up and tries again.I'd rather just have my headphone jack back,

Title: Much better than the stock, wired buds
Review: The air pods have quite a bit of battery life; enough for nearly a full day of music listening. The sound quality is quite impressive. Especially compared to the stock buds. While these don't seem to have ambient noise cancelation for the wearer, they do have impressive noise cancelation when on phone calls. My kids were in the middle of small riotous wrestling match while I was attempting to participate in a call. I apologized about the noise and was told they couldn't really hear anything other than my voice. I clarified they couldn't hear the shrieking and was told no. Impressive.

Title: These changed my life!!

I never feel like they’re going to fall out of my ears. I’ve done yard work, and gone running with them in and never had an issue. The only thing is the mic isn’t the BEST. I’m a singer and if I need my headphones to use my vocal app, it doesn’t always pick up the first part of a phrase and can pick up background noise. However, I’m still rather in love with the headphones. Highly recommend to anyone who will not lose them!

Title: If they’re thinking about buying these headphones? DO IT
Review: I was very skeptical ordering these since I read a ton of bad reviews.  But honestly?  I really love these.  They are authentic Apple AirPods and I’m very please with them.  They were super simple to set up (I have an iPhone XR) and all around I’m just happy with my purchase.  Don’t believe what everyone else is saying, as long as you buy new, you’ll be just fine!  These are 2nd gen.  AirPods.  I have the wired charging case since I didn’t see the point in spending 60 extra dollars to get the wireless.  So far they’ve held a charge extremely well.  I was always on the edge when it came to buying these, I’ve kinda always wanted them, but never bought them.  Now I’m SO glad I did.  To anyone who is debating buying these but isn’t sure?  DO IT you won’t regret it!

Title: Not apple product
Review: I ordered these airpods believing they were what they advertised to be which were "Apple Airpods".  They were in fact counterfeit or imitation airpods.  Purchased only 2 months ago, the sound quality began failing and so I contacted Amazon to report it.  They directed me to Apple as the product was still under manufacturer warranty.  When I explained situation to Apple representative, the serial number for the item was not in the Apple database.  So they directed me back to Amazon. I also purchased Apple Care from Amazon which made no sense if the Airpods were not actually an Apple product.  I believe this is false advertisement that the Airpods were sold under the "Apple" name as well as selling me "Apple care" for a "non Apple product".  I was refunded for both, but very disappointed.

Title: Complete let down...
Review: I have the first gen. AirPods for several years before I lost one to a dog incident and the other to a washing machine. LOVED THEM but didn't have the money to invest in a new pair at the time. Tried a few knockoff brands  for $20-$30 and had decent success but when I started travelling weekly for work, it was time to up the game again. Bought the new generation model and have been wildly disappointed ever since. Static regularly, battery life in average, on Zoom meetings they start going haywire at about the 40 minute mark and they only intermittently connect to my Microsoft Surface (which the knockoff brands had no problem doing). Maybe I just got a bunk pair of these but if I could go back to the originals I would. If I could also get my $200 back, I'd do that too. Sometimes newer isn't better.
