Title: easy to pair, terrible battery life
Review: It is amazingly easy to pair these bluetooth earphones and to switch between devices, which is why I bought them.  However, they are equally easy to knock out of your ears if you have long hair (so you may need to buy a cord to connect them and to hang around your neck).  My biggest complaint is the cruddy standby battery life.  If you leave them in your ears without any music playing the battery will still be dead in around 2 hours.  That is no where near the 5 hours of music per charge promised by Apple!  At this point I'm banking on durability to make up for the high price.  If these die in 6 months like all my other bluetooth headphones I will be furious and go back to cheaper alternatives with better battery life.

Title: Worth it!
Review: At first I was skeptical in buying this off Amazon and thought I’d be getting a knock off but I can say I’m definitely impressed. I decided to buy 2 pairs of these, one for myself and one for my husband for a Father’s Day gift. Working from home, I was getting tired of wearing a headset taking calls and having zoom meetings. This has definitely been a game changer for me. I love that I am able to connect it to my phone, laptop, and car with Bluetooth. It’s great that when I want to figure out what my battery percentage is for both the charging case and AirPods, it’ll tell me on my phone just by opening the charging case and the percentage for both will appear on the bottom of my phone screen. You can also tell when your case needs to be charged because there will be an orange light and if it’s charged enough, the light will be green as I show in the pictures. Same with the headphones. If you place the AirPods into the charging cradle, there will be an orange light if the charge is low and a green light when they are fully charged. These are not something you can wear for an entire day because the inside of your ear can become sore so I wear them when it’s necessary during my day. I love that there’s a feature where if I do have my headphones on, Siri will read my messages to me and you can send a reply as well. Siri feature is definitely great for when I am in the middle of something. Battery life, these haven’t lasted me for an entire day. I also love that when the AirPods are about to die, there’s a DUN-DUN noise that plays to let you know put me on the chargerrrrr. Other than that, I’m satisfied with my purchase and my husband will love the surprise when he receives it.

Title: Was AirPods Version 1, and would not pair or reset.
Review: I ordered the type "AirPods + Charging Case" on June 10th, 2020. (I followed the link back to here on the day I got the package to write this review.I received a nice looking set of Airpods version 1, not version 2.(The light is located on the inside of the case, so it's definitely a version 1. )It charged up fine, I left it plugged in for a few hours, but it would not pair to either of our iPhones, nor our new iPad or Macbooks.I tried resetting, holding the button down for 10 seconds, then 15, then 30 seconds. No change, stayed white. According to Apple's site a reset turns amber. No change after, still did not pair.Sending it back. I was expecting an AirPod version 2, and I was expecting it would pair.

Title: Real AirPods. Great listening. Could use a longer battery life

It’s very freeing to have Bluetooth headphones and they’re pretty comfortable.I had to give it a low rating on the battery life just because plenty of Bluetooth headphones come with an extremely long battery life (I’ve had Beats headphones that boast a 24-48 hr battery) and it’s a little disappointing given that Apple is a very well established company.I also checked the serial number of my pods and the validity of the warranty on Apple’s website. I can confirm that I received real AirPods. I would suggest anyone who is uncertain about buying from Amazon due to authenticity just make sure you’re not buying third party and check the serial number on Apples website so if you receive fakes you can get Amazon support on it right away. Serial number is located on the inside-top-left of the case.

Title: Fake Airpods
Review: In order to determine whether or not these AirPods were real, I immediately checked to see if the serial number matched Apple's official website. The number couldn't be verified. After opening the box, I noticed two things: "the Designed by Apple in California" was black, not grey, and inside the case were small black particles. Not only was it until I visited helpful websites that explain how to spot fake AirPods that I knew these were fake. Please don't be fooled by the packaging!Of course, this does not mean that all airpods from Amazon are fake. A friend of mine purchased them from here last year and hers was verifiable. So, I think it's a case-by-case situation. Make sure to do some research once you receive the package!Overall, I was looking so forward to finally purchasing my first Airpods, but the end result was very dismaying and disappointing. Although it would cost more, to play it safe, I would recommend purchasing from the official website!

Title: EAR SPECIFIC and QUALITY
Review: A FEW DAYS AFTER MY REVIEW...CHANGE THE 5 STAR TO 4: It’s stilly excellent. My friends can hear me very well and I, them. Their complain is there hearing a lot of background noise and apparently, I can do nothing to stop that.  I thought I’d use them for conversation in store, but now, I hesitate to do so, because friends would be side tracked with all the sound around me.  Still the best I could find and the best that is recommended by my friends. FIRST REVIEW WAS 5 start—as follows: Silly thought, right? Everything about these ear buds is what I hoped.....quality. How hard It is, purchasing anything these days and being anxious about the quality or lack there of, no matter what you pay for the product. (If this is confusing to you, please read the novel  Atlas Shrugged by Ayn Rand.) The ear specific fit, sound quality, apperance.....all are wonderful. Ease of connecting to any of my devices....WONDERFUL. I cannot rate construction longevity nor battery life, because I have only had them for a few days, and before that, I had the plug in buds that I rarely used, because I kept sitting the phone down to use my hands in the kitchen, and dragging my phone off Of a surface by moving around. Trying to hear friends on their speakers, because they are busy, too became frustrating. This WAS the perfect answer. They hear me better and finally, I can hear them even when they turn their back to their phone.  You will hear from me if they break down anytime soon.....promise. Since my iphone is the new SE2020, trouble shooting, if any problem arrises, will definitely be a breeze. I am so enjoying these airbuds. Voice activation helped type this review.

Title: Works well with Android devices but have some issues
Review: I wanted wireless headphones because I wear them while I exercise outdoors in the morning and while I clean the house etc and was tired of getting hung up on the cord.  I bought these to use on my Galaxy S8 because there are no Android headphones on the market of this shape.  I can't stand the type that push into your ear canal so I was happy to read that these would work with android.  You don't get all the features with an android device obviously but that was of little concern to me.  I don't need to tell Siri to turn up the volume or battery life to be displayed on my screen.  The only issues I have are with the headphones themselves that have nothing to do with android usage.  First, they are a bit uncomfortable for someone with smaller ears I guess.  The hard plastic rubs on my inner ear with long usage.  My husband doesn't have this problem with his.  I am also have trouble with them cutting out a bit and sometimes going out of sync when I am using them to stream.  It is worse when I put my phone in my pocket. Title: No more snagging!
Review: I run a lot and was thoroughly exhausted by my wires headphones always snagging on something. I put up with it for a long time because my prior experiences with Bluetooth anything had always been messy- it had always been a pain to get things to connect correctly, always some settings to fiddle with and turning it off and on again to reset something so that everything pairs up.  But these are quick and easy. Just pop them out of the case reasonably close to your phone and everything pairs up. As for the audio quality, it seems reasonably good. I’m no audiophile or anything, but I can’t really hear a difference between the AirPods and the wired set I was using before- admittedly the pair that came in the box with my phone.  Overall I’d say that if you, like me, are looking for something that’s easy to use and wire free, this is it chief.

Title: I love these Gen 1 airpods so much!
Review: I had borrowed a friend's old AirPods gen 1 for about 3 weeks until I had to give them back. After one week without AirPods filled with relentless struggle using cheaper wireless earbuds, I realized I had to buy my own pair! That one week was torture!I can't tell you how happy I am to be using these AirPods again! The design is sleek, slender and pocket-friendly. The wireless connection is superb between my iPhone and MacBook. Plus- if a friend also has airpods, you can "bump" your sound and listen to the same song, podcast or tv show coming from one apple device.A few things to note: these are NOT the wireless charging (gen 2) airports. They come with a lightning cable but NOT a charging block.

The second time they even went through the dryer.THEY STILL WORK!!!!! I couldn't believe it. I think they are sweat proof, but I never expected them to last through two loads of laundry.  Seriously couldn't believe it.  I'm very happy with these and hope at some point to get the new airpods with noise cancelling!  Thank you Apple for this great product!

Title: Airpods Regular vs. Airpods Pro
Review: I bought the pro version three months ago and accidentally tossed them (I was drying them with tissues) so I went for the cheapest replacement (Airpods 2). Here are my thoughts as to which one to choose.If this is the only listening device you have and you care about music quality, then buy Airpods Pro (noticeably superior music quality that falls far below earphones such as Sennheiser HD599; the quality is also below that of Boss QC35II).If you use this to listen to audiobooks, or if you have better earphones for music at home, by all means go for the regular Airpods. Why? I personally find it far more comfortable. The regular airpods are like the earbuds that come with Iphones -- while not the most comfortable, wearing them for two hours is not a big problem. I found the pro version extremely uncomfortable for more than an hour. The noise cancellation is cool, very cool, but not essential for my usage.If you travel frequently on domestic/short flights, then airpods pro might be great for its noise cancellation feature. But bear in mind Pro airpods are not the most comfortable. Moreover, battery lasts about 5 hours so airpods won't be ideal for longhaul flights.What I like about both: if you have lots of Apple devices, switching across these devices is very easy (2-3 clicks/taps).So for this regular version, I rate:3/5 for music quality;4/5 for comfort;0 for noise cancellation.

Title: Great Light Weight  Device, But.....
Review: I bought these because I had trouble keeping similar wireless headphones in my ears while walking or exercising.  Other wired or wireless headsets with interchangeable, difference sized soft ear pieces never fit right and had a tendency to come loose or slip out entirely.  Very annoying at the gym in the middle of a class or on the treadmill. These are so light and hang on the ear that you don't notice they are there.Frankly I don't use them on an 'i' device but on an Android phone.  That shouldn't matter.  The only negative is that every once in a while they seem to go out of sync.  This causes an echo effect.  It becomes difficult to understand spoken word because of the echo.  The only way I have found to fix it is to go to Bluetooth settings, disconnect, then reconnect the AirPoids.  That means I have to stop my exercise program to restart them.  Very annoying.  The connected device used shouldn't matter if the Bluetooth is compatible.

Title: Genuine 2nd Generation AirPods
Review: My AirPods were purchased directly from Apple and were shipped by Amazon, so I was expecting and received a genuine product.  I read a lot of comments regarding if these are the 2nd generation AirPods, and I was a little confused myself.  The charging case for the AirPods that I received had the indicator light on the inside of the case instead of on the outside; which is how Apple designed the first generation of AirPods.  After doing some research, this is also how Apple designed the second generation of AirPods, IF they do NOT have wireless charging.  So the only AirPods that do have the indicator on the outside of the case are the second generation, wireless charging AirPods.  After checking my products warranty on Apple's website, it confirmed that these are the 2nd generation AirPods; and also confirmed that these are real AirPods.

Title: Good device but they need to sit in your ear just right
Review: Great device, but make sure it is fitting your ear correct or they will fall out. I haven't been able to narrow down exactly what it is, but every now and then one will fall out or slip to some crazy angle. I am super careful but it will get me sometime, I am near positive. I have seen it quite a few times on planes where people fall asleep and wake up to find their ear bud gone. It happens.For being a tiny little device, they seem to do pretty well on holding power. To mitigate any real possible problems, I use the charging case whenever I can. Go to lunch, charge them for 1/2 hour. Driving home from work, charge in the truck for that time while charging the case as well.Sound seems to be pretty good. I can jack my iPhone up quite a bit and not really hear any distortion. I use these with a MPow Bluetooth adapter and I get distortion there, but I have proven it is the MPow.Rarely do I use the Airpods with my phone in a noisy condition so i don't have much to say about noise cancellation. I also rarely use the touch features minus the "oops I just turned them off again" accidental.One thing that is a bit annoying is in regard to the charging case. I work in an industrial environment. Somehow, that case tends to find every single metal shaving known to man. Getting it away from the magnetic pull of the case can be a real pain in the butt. I use a tiny plastic screw driver to lightly scrap it away so I don't dig into the plastic. Depending on how much you have there, This can be tedious to get out.

I felt like wireless charging case is unnecessary so I got the wired charging one. And clearly they sent me the AirPods 1 since the case is different. And the reason why I can tell is the delay is the same with the ones I used before. And most importantly, I just got this yesterday and the battery is already different for these two earbuds. So I'm gonna say if you really want or it's necessary get the wireless one, that might be the 2nd generation. Otherwise it's really not worth buying, waste of money.

The airpods also fit very well in my ears and I almost never have problems with them falling out unless I don’t adjust for a long period of time. The sound quality is very good and sounds AMAZING with certain songs. (They come with the airpods already in charging case, a cable to charge the case and a manual for extra guidance). Noise cancellation isn’t noticeable but then again these are not designed for noise cancellation so I Wasn’t really expecting that aspect. I gave noise cancellation 2 stars in case someone might be looking for that. Battery life is as expected and there isn’t a complaint there. Here’s my main complaint and I consider it a big one. For the first couple weeks i have really enjoyed the AirPods and used them for hands free calling. Within the last week people have started complaining they cannot hear me very well while speaking on the phone. I have tried adjusting the position of the buds in case the mic wasn’t close to my mouth and I have tried cleaning them but things haven’t improved. Here’s the kick in the teeth...yesterday was the last day for me to return them through Amazon. I’m currently waiting to speak with apple.

Title: Love Hate Relationship
Review: I'm fully in the Apple Ecosystem: iPhone, iPad, Mac. It was time to replace my wireless headphones and heard so much about the Airpods and so many friends love them, decided to stay Apple.  Indeed Airpods work great with Apple products. If that's all you're going to use them for, don't hesitate. I've bought and returned 3 other airbud products. Primary issue was the device staying in the ear, then sound quality.  Airpods stay in your ears and the sound is very good for the price point.HOWEVER........I'm primarily interested in wireless help with hearing especially my TVs.  I do not have Apple TV. One TV is a smart Samsung with Bluetooth and the other is Panasonic that I've added a Bluetooth transmitter.  Anything that's not Apple has no issue pairing with the TVs.  When it comes to pairing the Airpods, my blood pressure rises each time. Sometimes they pair, sometimes not.  But that's not the real issue.  The Airpods do not have independent sound control. If you're using an Apple device, you control the sound through the device like phone, watch etc.  However, my TVs (two major brands) do not have volume control for output. Very few TVs do.  So if the volume is too high or too low, I need to disconnect from the TV, pair with an Apple device, get the volume where I think I want it, then disconnect, then re-pair with the TV and hope the volume is somewhere near where I like it.I spoke with Apple about this and their response is buy an Apple TV device. That way the Airpod will pair and sound can be controlled. In my case, I would need to buy 2 Apple TV devices.  The low priced airbuds come with volume control, apparently there isn't any technology magic required.  Apple is choosing to not include.I'm still undecided about returning the Airpods. The fit, comfort and sound are well worth the price. The volume annoyance is a reminder each time I use these things that Apple is not the customer focused/design company we think they are.  Before I bought the Airpods, I spoke with 3 friends who use and highly recommend.  Each one told me I would be able to control the volume with my iPhone or iPad. After talking with Apple, that is not the case.While on that subject, since my last Apple purchase this is the first time in about 18 months that I've needed to talk with Apple support.  What has happened over there?  Four calls in two weeks; each time I feel like I'm speaking with someone that is just reading a script and doesn't really understand the issue.  The solution to most any issue seems to be, buy something else Apple.  As a long time shareholder who's gone through a lot of stock splits, I appreciate the focus on Apple products but come on, there's more solutions to improving an Apple product than buying another Apple product.

Title: It's an Apple product what's to say?
Review: It's an Apple product, and like all Apple products its very beautifully and nicely packaged, and for the most part works very good.  And, like all Apple products they are manufactured by China for pennies on the dollar, and then Apple marks up the price by a thousand percent, and passes that very expensive price to US customers. Nothing more needs to be said about Apple products and business practices in the US, and support for foreign labor, instead of US labor. And, don't forget the Apple Care they would love for you to get, that strangely always seems to expire just a few days before your product gives out. It's like if they install a Mission Imposible "this item will self destruct in 5 sec" destruct switch inside your item to go off a few days before your Apple care expires.

Title: My son loves these
Review: Bought these for my son. He loves them and uses them every day.

Title: On the Fence?
Review: I was on the fence for quite awhile about whether I needed these as I own everything Apple, but I held back and that was a mistake! Apple quality SHINES once again! Everything about these is exactly as you would expect from Apple, you really do get what you pay for! I am very pleased with the airpods, I am enjoying them as I write this review, the sound is absolutely excellent! I had zero issues setting them up with my Iphone. The quality in craftsmanship and quality is pure Apple, The sound is amazingly excellent! They are comfortable to wear. I have not tried any heavy duty physical activity with them on but I'm sure there are other reviews here that cover that. I waited too long! The price is reasonable for something that will give you many years of pleasure!

Title: They did not work

Title: LOVE AIRPODS!
Review: I absolutely loveee these AirPods!  I was a little hesitant because it’s Amazon, but the company is Apple directly themselves if I’mnot mistaken. I’ve had them since early April and they’re working well, I haven’t found any issues. I bought the regular charging case, not wireless. It charges well, I haven’t found a battery issue. Given we’re living that quarantine life (written from New York by the city In May 2020 lol) I haven’t gotten much of a chance to try them out for a full day out traveling. But I’m confident I won’t find an issue even then. They work great! The sound goes LOUD! I’ve heard with certain wireless headphones they don’t go too loud to keep from damaging peoples ears, my friends don’t like it though because they don’t even get the option of raising it louder if they wanted to. Honestly these AirPods are worth it. I can’t see what difference there would be buying them directly from an Apple website vs Amazon, it says they’re from Apple. I have no reason to believe otherwise since they work well. An Apple protection plan is offered too. Which I got, because I’m accident prone! It was worth the total price I spent, I’m very happy with my purchase. They’re so useful! If you’re thinking of getting AirPods, buying them here from Amazon is a purchase you shouldn’t regret, the price is good and the product is good!

Thanks, Apple, for keeping life interesting.

Title: First time Apple user
Review: I have been using the airpods for about a month now, and I am a first time Apple product userI have purchased less expensive airpods/earbuds and these are the best by farShipping was fast, and packaging was in tactConnectivity: I have an android phone, and connecting the airpods to my nonapple product was super easySound: When making and receiving phone calls, the sound quality was good. Way better than the other 3 earbud brands I own.  There was no choppiness, no computerized sound and the other party/myself did not sound like we were at a distance. Music and video sound was crispDistance: I live in an apartment. So I was able to leave my cell phone in room A, and go to rooms B and C without losing connection. I also was able to go outside without losing connectionBattery life: Kind of short. If you're on a 5+ hour road trip or flight, you'll have to recharge your pods. Overall, 5 hours is not badFit: They don't fall out of my ears. Also, It's more comfortable to use headphones for extended amounts of time. Only because there is no cushion on the airpodsThe  charging dock for the airpods is small and compact. I usually keep it connected to my laptop to keep it chargedOverall the apple airpods are worth the price, and I do recommend this product

Title: Wish I had splurged for the Pros
Review: They do get a little sore in my ears after a while. I wish the battery lasted just a smidge longer. I generally use them while doing things around the house, and they will last a few hours. The sound quality is very good. The input quality is better than the standard corded ear buds. It picks up my voice better. Noise cancellation is comparable to the standard ear buds.My biggest complaint is that these were not clean when I received them. I opted for the open box to get a discount on these. The description indicated that the box may have been opened and possibly damaged. However, it did not indicate that the item had been previously used. And especially considering the current pandemic situation, particular care should have been taken to ensure that the item had been cleaned. I spent about 20 minutes scraping ear wax out of the ear buds! Gross! And if you have had any Apple ear bud before, you know that it is very difficult to get into all of those tiny little crevices! I sincerely wish that Amazon had taken a little more care in the processing of returns such as this!

Title: Skeptical at first, they're the best!
Review: Truthfully, I waited a very long time to buy AirPods. I was concerned with their battery life, their ability to fall out of my ears, and especially their price. When I purchased the headphone jack-less iPhone 8 though, I knew it was time to switch.I love them! Their battery life is very impressive and you can charge just the case which is super cool. I didn't think the increased range of mobility would be that big of a deal, but it is so convenient to be able to have a greater range of motion while running. I can even cook and clean very easily all with music and not worrying about being attached to a phone. After trying them, they do feel pretty secure in my ears. Also, the sound quality is immaculate compared to my previous 20 dollar corded headphones. I'm going to college next year so I'm super excited ill be able to have complete focus even if others are making noise. My music is so clear!For all my skeptics out there, if you can afford them of course, they are a great purchase! I recommend.

Title: Were great, until they suddenly stopped working
Review: Had the airpods for 4 months and they were amazing. Sound quality was great, felt very comfortable, the whole nine yards. I loved these earbuds. After 4 months, without warning it just stopped working. It connects to my Samsung phone, but it doesn't play any sound. Ok weird, I'll just put it back in the case and take it out again (disconnect then reconnect). Still the same issue. Try to unpair the earbuds and pair them back and still nothing. Put the earbuds in the case and held the button to reset it until it gets that amber light and still nothing. I then thought ok maybe it's because I'm not using an iPhone, so I get my old IPhone 6 and try to connect it to that and see if it fixes it and what do ya know nothing. I kept resetting it so many times and I finally got one earbud to play sound. Right earbud plays sound and left one doesn't, ok cool progress. I tried resetting it a couple more times and now the left one plays sound but the right one doesn't. Continued resetting it and now the right earbud plays sound but the left one doesn't. It sucks, but at least I can still use one earbud. I'll continue to try and see if I can get both ear buds to work and if I do I'll update this review, but until then It's a 1 star for me :/

They do not block out sounds very well. For me I like being able to hear my surroundings so I like not total sound cancelation. The battery life is really good. I only charge the case every other month. Very good purchase.

Title: The perfect tool for WFH
Review: Day 2 of my WFH experience I realized I needed wireless audio capability to be more effective on video and audio teleconferences.  With meetings usually lasting one hour, and my schedule often having back-to-back meetings, it would be nice if the battery life were a little longer than the 3 hours. However, understanding that batteries add weight, and current technology is what it is, I'll go with bluetooth airpods any day! Just remember to park them in the recharger module between meetings so you don't have to switch to wired audio. These also work well when you're WFH with a significant other and you both need your own professional space, even if in an apartment.

Title: Range Sucks
Review: Let me start this review by saying that I'm using these pods with a Blackberry Priv that has an Android OS, so take that FWIW.  Maybe they aren't compatible, or optimally compatible, or whatever since they're an Apple device.  I don't know, but the point of having them is to be able to listen to my phone without wires, and they don't allow that very well.The range is limited, like less than a few feet, and depending on where I'm using them it's less than that.  For example, I can be at the gym on an incline bench, set my phone on the floor next to me, and the podcast that I'm listening to cuts out. Maybe there's interference from the gym's piped in music - they work well enough when they're about 10 inches away from me in the rack on the elliptical machine.This afternoon I was washing my car in my garage.  When I was washing the tires I left the phone on the hood of the car, and when I went to wash the rear tires, my podcast cut out.  I ended up turning them off them and using the speaker in the phone.The only time these pods really work is when I'm driving and I have my phone on my lap.  YMMV depending on how, when, and where you use them.

Title: Amazing Sound Quality but Some Cons
Review: Update: I've had these for six months and the case has stopped charging. They are essentially useless now. I would recommend purchasing through Apple so you can get another pair if yours malfunctions. Since I purchased on here and the return window is closed, I cannot get another pair, which means $130 down the drain.This was definitely one of my best Amazon purchases. The sound quality on these is amazing even during phone calls. The charging case holds an impressive amount of charge so I only need to recharge it once every 2-3 days, which isn't very much considering I use these 8-10 hours a day.at work. That being said, there are some cons to these. The battery life of the AirPods themselves isn't the best-- you'll get 1-2 hours max. Now, five minutes in the charging case will get these back to full charge, so take that with a grain of salt. The biggest con for me has been the Bluetooth connectivity. I have an IPhone 11 so I would expect these to have no issues with connecting. However, every few times I use these, one or both of the AirPods does not connect when I pull it out of the case. It usually takes about five minutes to figure out the problem and re-connect them. It's definitely a problem when I'm trying to pick up a call on my AirPods or listen to something quickly. For that reason, I'd give these 4/5 stars. They're still worth the purchase but I'd recommend adding AppleCare so you can get a replacement if you have the same issues. (P.S. If you have an Apple watch, these do not connect independently to the Apple Watch, you will need to have your IPhone on you.)

Title: Best headphones I've ever owned
Review: I didn't really want to get AirPods, but I ruined my Bose sound-sport free wireless by leaving them out in the rain. I got these and didn't expect the sound quality to be so good! Not noise canceling, but they don't claim that. It's hard to hear sounds around you when you turn them up a bit, but the quality of sounds is so good! They were a bit uncomfortable in my ears at first, but then I learned you don't push them in as much and let them sit in the contours of your ears. They don't fall out at all, which was surprising, even when I run. My favorite feature is that they pause my music when I remove one. I think they're probably the best headphones I've ever had and I'm sad I took this long to order a pair! I'd highly recommend to anyone!

Title: Best purchase so far

They have an amazing sound quality and they connect to your phone almost right away. It’s a little more difficult for people like me who only use one side most of the time since sometimes they won’t catch that it’s in your ear but they’re still great products.The charging speed of Airpods is INSANE, you can fully charge them in like 30 minutes. When your Airpods die you can put them in the case and they’ll get charged most of the way in like 10 minutes and they still last a long time before having to charge them.

Title: Sound is Great. They Really Hurt & Fall Out Often!
Review: Disappointed. I wanted to love these AirPods. The sound is perfect. Zero complaints with the sound quality. However, these really hurt. They should not cause you pain. When I say hurt, it is truly painful! This is not a mild discomfort. I tried to ignore it the first day, but after a few tries it is miserable. I tried barely placing them in my ear and adjusting it, it relieved some of the pain pressure but it still hurt. They keep falling out too!! So if you adjust it to barely go into your ear, hopefully you are not moving around and working out because these will fall out repeatedly disrupting your workout. I am so surprised at how badly these AirPods have turned out to be. They are expensive! If I had known, I never would have spent this much money. I saw others using them and just thought they would be great. THEY CAUSE PAIN AND FALL OUT REPEATEDLY. You would think that someone could design something better. I need to find something better! No sound is worth all of this suffering. My ears and head hurt hours after I remove these. Yes, it causes headaches. It’s so sad, because they have terrific sound and they look cool too. This is a BIG disappointment. My advice: Do NOT waste your money.

I can get ones from the apple store and they’ll be exactly the same.

Title: Mothers Day Gift **** FAIL ****** Defective and Dirty
Review: 1.  One pod was muffled while other pod was fine.  Fully charged and tried again.  Independently confirmed faulty pod with different iphones of 20-somethings.2.  Caked piece of dirt under closed case lid.  Was located both on underside of lid near hinge and the surface where the pods are inserted - in plain sight.  Tried to scrape off but could not.  Packaging was clearly factory from outside to inside.Between dirt and defective equipment it sure seemed like manufacturer repackaged faulty and/or poor Quality Control.  Not a good look for Mothers Day with family around.  Wife deserves upgrade to noise cancelling. Returning for replacement.  Hopefully wife gets before school year over (kindergarten teacher using Zoom).

Title: Amazing
Review: These earbuds are great. I was hesitant to get them at first, fearing they would fall out of my ears or I would lose them. They are secure in my ears whenever I wear them and carrying them around in the charging case makes it less likely to lose them. I did forget about them in my pocket and ran them through the wash. I took them out and they played normally right away. I put them in rice for 72 hours and they still played fine.I have used these with my iPhone XS, Windows 10 laptop and iPad and for all devices they work great.I am still getting used to the commands/taps that come with these. I would like to find more info on that.I bought these when they were under $100, which I felt was a steal. They are great to have!

Title: Be weary of purchasing AirPods from Amazon
Review: Be weary of purchasing AirPods from Amazon. I received an unsealed and dirty box. At first I thought nothing of it until I saw that the AirPods had already been named when I went to pair them. At closer examination, I noticed the AirPods themselves were actually dirty. They also didn’t come with a manual. I couldn’t get over the fact they might have been in some random persons ears and returned them. Just bought a new pair from a store and the box was sealed, came with a manual and were unnamed.

Title: Worst product ever - Apple does not support them
Review: So, the first set stopped working within a couple days.  The replacement set started having garbled sound in 4 months and after diagnosing it for 45 minutes with Apple Support, they said that would replace them for $150.98, even though they were under warranty and that's because they have limited warranty.  I asked for a supervisor.  When I he came on the line, he went through all the same steps again and said that he would replace them for free.  What is happening with Apple??  Anyway, it finally worked out, but I did have to give them my credit card to be charged until the old ones were received back, since they are sending the replacement in advance.  They can still decide not to accept the returned item.  If they do, I will come back and update this.

DO NOT buy from this company!!!  Don't do it.

Title: Love
Review: I bloody love these things.I don't have an iPhone, I'm an android lady and I still love these things.Sound quality and microphone quality are second to none, and they last forever battery, wise.Admittedly that get a little sore in my ears after a few hours, but....hours. And I have really small ears.I went through four other sets of headphones though again that were a fraction of the price and they all sucked in one way or another, and I ended up returning them, very disappointed. I sucked it up and bought these and never looked back.If you're hemmin' and hawin'...just buy them already.

Title: Theres a reason why everyone loves them
Review: I ordered these and a pair of Bultone ear buds in the same month. These are one of the best purchases I have ever made in terms of convenience, lifestyle enhancement, and general happiness.Pros:1. sound quality - perfect for music - great, even tone and quality bass, reliable never any static or wonky pitches 2. Bluetooth connection - só reliable and easy to connect. Once paired with a device it’s seamless; just pop them in your ears. Can stray a pretty good distance from your device and still have good reception.3. Call quality & Siri - call quality is awesome and works without the other party even noticing I’m on Bluetooth. Have used them for both business and personal calls in the car and at home for hour long conferences as well as quick hit calls. Never had a problem with people hearing me or hearing the other parties. Really love that Siri announces notifications when I’m using them.4. Personalization - Love that you can tweak the controls to your own preferences.ConsCharging - While charging the ear buds is super fast and easy I will say that the charging case doesn’t seem to hold a charge as long as the Bultone case does. The buds themselves also don’t hold a charge as long as my Bultone buds do.Fit - I have very small ears and these are comfortable but they fall out occasionally. I am not comfortable wearing them out and about in public after having lost one on several occasions when it just spontaneously popped out of my ear.Price - would be nice if these were closer to the 99.00 price point. Just feel the 150.00 price range they hover in is a tad high but I would buy them again for sure

Title: Ear buds die within a couple of hours
Review: The ear buds die quickly.  I know people who can go hours, if not all day with them in and no issues.  I have to recharge mine multiple times a day, which is extremely inconvenient when I am on the phone all day long.Not very comfortable either.

Title: Great buds for the price; I like them better than the Pros!
Review: Ok there not Hi-fi, but there pretty darn good! I initially bought the AirPods Pro for the noise canceling (I fly a lot)! However, after  using them after several flights, I hated the white noise they produced, as well as, the fit just did not work for me. I tried several ear tips but they kept falling out. That being said the AirPods 2 are great for my ears (no white noise) yes they don’t have active noise canceling but I think the sound great for the price. They also fit my ears perfectly. Reason for four stars is that as an Apple product who owns beats I expected better highs and mid-tones. They do have pretty good base for the size of the ear pod and the sound is not blown out. Unlike the beats pro. I also got Apple care via Apple (recommendation: use amazon to buy Apple care, you’ll save yourself a headache trying to get apple to verify your purchase it was about a half hour of work to get apple to override the system and apply the Apple care. But they were friendly and did Got it done.)

Title: Great sound quality!
Review: I really enjoy listening to these while I work; it's portable, quite noise canceling and I was surprised at how clear the sound quality was compared to my other generic bluetooth ear buds that I had used prior to buying these. The only thing I wish that could be improved is the battery life. Unfortunately it can only last you up to 4 or 5 hours before you have to slide it back into its case for charging.

Title: Great, but issues
Review: I like these better than the buds I bought that fit in the ear.  Those always fell out and started to hurt after about 20 minutes of use.  These sound great and don't fall out.  HOWEVER, I'm having pairing issues with my iphone/watch.  The sound doesn't always come through the headphones after connecting to my phone.  I have to stop and start several times to get it to go through the headphones.  Then if I pause and start again using my watch, I have to do the whole process of switching sound back to headphones.  I'm not sure what is happening.  I'm sure I'll figure it out.  I haven't had that issue with my ipad, so I'm sure it's something to do with the phone and watch working together.  Overall, these fit in my ear better than Echo Buds, the sound quality is good, but it's lacking noise cancelling.  I just didn't think it was worth $100 to go up to the Pros for that..

Title: Won’t stay in my ear
Review: The AirPods arrived in great condition, nice packaging but they do not stay put in my ear at all. I attempted to wear one around the house while doing light chores and it fell out several times and required adjusting multiple times. I should have known that these wouldn’t work for me, my regular corded earbuds do the same thing. I don’t imagine that I’d be able to workout or do much of anything without them falling out. I’ll be returning them and purchasing a much more inexpensive pair that allows me to adjust the ear cover for a better fit. Good product for most, but not a good fit for meUpdate 5/14/20So these are advertised as being the latest generation. My case that came with the AirPods have a model number that would indicate the case is 1st generation. The AirPods have different model numbers that would indicate that they weren’t manufactured as pair. There’s something fishy with these although they work. Check your numbers......my settings on my phone show a model number that is in fact different than what’s printed on the actual device. I wouldn’t be surprised if these were refurbished, all the different serial numbers confirm that this wasn’t an original pair because they have different manufacture dates

Title: Your caller can hear you!

The only downfall with other wireless earbuds is the static noise that your caller/ or who you call get when you are talking.  They have a hard time hearing you with the less expensive versions.  Easy to see why Apple still has the best products, its well worth the money.

Title: THESE ARE NOT AIRPODS!
Review: I own a pair of airpods, as do pretty much all the members of my family. I ordered these, seeing that they came from apple, for my dad, and what we got were NOT airpods. The charging cord did not fit, the button was missing, the airpods didn't even FIT IN THE CHARGING CASE. When they were delivered, the plastic wasn't wrapped around the box (which it always is when you buy any apple product), which was the first red flag. Then we opened them and saw the disaster that was inside. I'm so pissed, disappoint, annoyed. I don't know WHAT went wrong here, but I did not receive the product I ordered. I fully believe I was scammed, so just be careful.

Title: ***LOUD*** calendar alerts may damage hearing and no way to adjust volume
Review: The loudness of calendar alerts is a deal-breaker.  It is maximum volume and seriously likely to damage your hearing and/or give you a heart attack.  When the alert goes off you claw at your skull to rip these out of your ears it is that bad.  I have thrown them across the room.This is a known bug with these.I researched this for days and the best i found was one method to adjust volume (kill all apps, reduce volume, use as normal( but as soon as you adjust the volume through a different app or on another set of Bluetooth speakers, it goes back to maximum.There is no practical way to control this.If you use your Airpods and phone for business and have a lot of calendar alerts, the Airpods suck.On the positive side, the sound is pretty good.They also charge very rapidly in the case - very pleasantly surprised at that.  I get about 4 - 5 charges from the case's battery before that has to be recharged.The feature for checking the battery on your iPhone by opening the case near the phone is also very cool.If they could fix the calendar bug they would be 5/5 rated.

Title: Great!
Review: My son talked me into buying AirPods. They seemed kind of superfluous. An expensive and possibly of limited value item. But I liked the idea of getting a greater range of uses with my Apple Watch.Now I don’t go anywhere without them. They sync with my watch in a few seconds. I now listen to more podcasts and have made numerous phone calls with great ease. I use them with my iPhone when I want to listen to music without disturbing anyone. When I walk my dog, I use one pod so that I can walk her safely, and I find that to be quite satisfactory. The design is wonderful and functional. The case feels solid and is easy to carry in pants pockets. Finally, the sound quality is outstanding, far exceeding my expectations. They’re not cheap, but you have to pay a little more for such an exemplary product.

Title: Defective, Dangerous!
Review: DO NOT BUY THESE AIRPODS!! After 10 mins of use, the left pod started to heat up causing ear pain. After using right pod for 30 mins, I got severe headache. Called the Apple support for help. They put me on hold for 30 mins, transferred the call from one department to another. Finally the supervisor lady said she can’t do anything since the return window has expired. Waste of time and money! I have stopped using these and back to the wired headphones.

Title: Good, if you don’t like your music blasting in your ears

Title: Worth every penny
Review: I am so glad I finally ordered these. The clarity is unbelievable. They have fallen out of my ears a few times so I did order a harness for when I am out.

Title: Best little headphones
Review: If I could befriend headphones, these would be the ones.  They're intuitive, easy to use, sound great, and worth the price now that I've had them a year and go nowhere without them.  I usually use one at a time so I can still hear around me and save on battery.  I've rarely dropped, but the couple of times I have, they've been just fine.  I love how easy they are to use with iPhone, MacBook, iMac.  They charge fast! I've not tried the pros, don't see any reason at this time because these fit comfortably and are so amazing!  I tried knock offs twice before these and am so glad I dropped that nonsense and bit the bullet on these higher priced, but oh so superior, headphones. I didn't think wires were a big deal until I moved to these and then tried to use the wired headphones once. Yuk. Almost pulled my MacBook right off the table. Goof. The case is slippery smooth; I would absolutely recommend a case of choice (I have Spongebob). Enjoy!

Title: Sounds Great, may loose one if you're a really active person.
Review: Great Sound for all types of music if its been recorded right. And They're worth it because they stay connected. This is my Third pair because I Always loose one (right/left) from falling out my ear. I drive Tow Trucks and use Air pods for answering call ($500.00 Fine for Commercial vech. if get caught driving with phone near your ear.). Amazon sells small ear adaptors for Air pods ($2.00-$10.00). Think its time for me to invest in a couple of those adaptors.  Thanks

Title: Super sound
Review: How can you not like , comfortable to wear

Title: Be Wary of Used AirPods
Review: I’ve had these AirPods since April 18th. They are legitimately some good AirPods. I don’t recommend getting them used because you’re  really testing your luck because previous owner could swap the AirPods (you could have a real case, but fake AirPods). But if you want to check if they are fake, check for magnets. If the AirPods push away from each other, they are real.

Title: AirPods still the best
Review: Went for the 2nd gen as opposed to the hard to locate, and more expensive latest gen. These work perfectly and suit me for what I do, the only continued struggle with these head phones is around the use of them for high impact workouts, they simply will not stay in my ears with so much movement. I do not see it as a criticism they work  fine for the most part, so for me they were the perfect purchase.

Title: Worth the Money!!!

Sound quality is fantastic, no cord getting in the way while running or working out, and both the airpods and charging case charge quickly.  The range of the bluetooth is amazing as well.  i left my phone on my living room couch and was outside washing the car and the music and phone calls continued to work!!  Excellent product and definitely worth the money is you work out or run!!

Title: Absolutely horrible
Review: Absolutely horrible experience with both the product and the shipping. For starters, I pay for prime membership, and didn’t get the package until around two weeks after I reported that my original package never arrived.Now my AirPod case won’t charge my AirPods after less than one year of owning it! I always took care of the case, bought a protector for it, only ever used compressed air to clean it, and always clipped it into my waist. There is absolutely zero reason that it should have stopped working. Save yourself the time and don’t buy the product, it’s a dud. They’re sucking your money out of your wallet and giving horrible quality in return. Now my AirPods are useless and they’ll charge $70 just for another dud of an AirPods case.

Title: Awesome

These are so comfy and I do not find myself adjusting them as much because of the design. I bought air pods because I found it hard to work out with my wire ones. They sound great and they stay on throughout my hour workout. I recommend them and I am glad I got them. Battery will last me about 3-4 hours without charging in between and the AirPod charges the earbuds really quickly while maintaining a good amount of charge for itself.

Abs - you better believe they fall out, etc etc.  So, my kid is taking these and I’m going back to my 4 year old mpow wired bluetooth which won’t fall out.  Bottom line, if you don’t do much physical activity and you just something while at your desk or just sitting or walking around these will be perfect.

Title: Well worth the $$$
Review: I love these earbuds.  I have a few pair, and these make the others look like trash.  Pairing couldn’t be simpler, they are lightweight and super comfortable, fit well, and couldn’t be simpler to use.  These are great earbuds.The reason I only gave them a lower rSting is the sound quality.  It’s not bad, but it’s also pretty far from great.  The sound is nicely balanced, but lacks any punch.  They do sound amazing with a few albums, but that is rare.  The sound is usually flat and lacking dynamics.  Still, they sound good enough.Overall, though, I am happy.  I do recommend them, but with a caveat.

Title: If you have small ear holes....
Review: I have very small ears apparently.  I have spent 100's of dollars trying to find a pair of headphones that work for me.. these are still not them.  If you have small ear holes these will fall out constantly.  So, I honestly hate using these so much... BUT, with all that being said, they are VERY comfortable.. they do not hurt my ears at.. again small ear holes, a lot of headphones start hurting within 30 minutes of wearing them.  The sound is REALLY good.  The convenience is the only reason I didn't return them.  The battery life lasts FOREVER..  I think I have charged them three times since I got them * I don't use them everyday*.  They connect really easily too.  If you have small ears hard pass but if you have normal ears then these are for you..  The best way to know if they will fit and stay in is to wear the ones the phone came with... exactly the same fit without the mess of a cord.

Title: Excellent convenience, sound quality, battery and design make airpods worth the price!
Review: Love these!Bought multiple sets for the entire family! The sound quality of the 2nd generation airpods has certainly improved from the 1st generation. The sound is still crisp, but the "bass" is greatly enhanced. This brings the new generation nearly up to the five-star level of earbuds like the $300 Stennheiser Momentum True Wireless 2.Apple's airpods aren't built for complete noise cancellation. Although the ear-form shape of Apple's airpods help prohibit background noise somewhat, if you're looking for complete noise cancellation you'd be better served looking for earbuds designed for that purpose, like the $228 Sony WF-1000XM3. However, if you're like me and don't mind simply upping the volume a notch or two, Apple airpods will do just fine.The contoured shape has another benefit: the airpods stay in very well while doing activites. I took them for a run with no issues, and played a little basketball and only had to readjust them a couple times.The battery life of Apple's airpods is as good as advertised, giving close to five hours of music playback in my test. Unless you're going for multiple marathons per day, they will more than suffice.The hallmark of airpods are their convenience. They automatically pair with your phone as soon as you open your case. The case, by the way, is as smooth and chic as it looks. The pods are touch controllable, meaning you can skip, rewind change volume, and control calls all with a tap. The call quality is great as well, almost better than an actual phone.In summary, for the fine-tuned product that Apple airpods are, the price is a bargain!

Anyway, if you're concerned just call Apple and they will let you know. Also, I'm not impressed with the 5 hour battery on one full charge, mine seems to be a little less than that but those are the stats so gotta live with it. I know apple can do better than that.Anyways Happy shopping!

Title: Apple won't help if u have a problem.
Review: let me start with there are 5 people in my house. Which all have apple phone, I pads and air pods. I got my daughter air pods for Christmas 2019. Since the left ear bud stopped working and the case has metal fragments in it.  Cleary a defective case. I called customer support and was given 2 options. Take it to a apple store or best buy. All which are closed in PA due to Covid 19. Or pay a refundable deposit of 59.00 for the ear bud and 69.00 for the case. I don't feel like I should have to make that large of a deposit since they were 99.00 new. I asked for a manager. Who also said that is all I can offer you at this point. This burned mybutt,  since I have spent a lot of money on Apple products over the years. May I say I my self have switched to Samsung. At this point I'm tempted to switch my entire family too. You can be loyal like a dog. But you will be beat with the news paper for sure. They won't dare go out of there way to help you. I'm so over the BS with the customer service dept

They are worth the money.

Title: Sounds better than the Galaxy buds. Period.
Review: Sounds better than my buds side by side on note, iPhone X, iPads pro 2rd gen. The bass on the airpods is clear and solid. The overall sound dynamics are far more weighty and coherent, listening to both Wagner's grand March and talking videos. The Samsung wearable app is useless as far as the sound quality goes.The magnetic mechanism of the airpods charger keeps the pods securely connected. The Galaxy buds weren't charged at all for me once when they weren't sat properly somehow. If not handled carefully, the little buds can easily fall out of the charger and lost.Airpods have two legs make them easier to handle and they do NOT make the pods fall off. In fact I am pleasantly surprised that the pods are very secure in the ears without the rubbery pieces like the Galaxy buds do. You need to put the buds on the right way to secure them in the ears. Airpods just securely sit in the ears, no wiggling needed. Several times the playback were interrupted when I try to wiggle the Galaxy buds in my ears.Not so great: airpods need to hold the button on the charger to connect to a new device the first time, a rather ancient way of doing business. Worse, no visual audio feedback when holding the button on the pods or the charger. Apple should have gone all the way like all the other Bluetooth devices, flash red or blue lights while at it.  Samsung buds has no need for that. But on the other hand, Galaxy buds need the app for Android. Should have been optional .The last one is IMHO for sure: I like the Samsung charger better, only if it has the same magnetic mechanisms. It just looks cooler and more solid. The airpods charger looks like a floss box. The shiny white plastic is slippery and the little lid feels flimsy comparing to the Galaxy charger, which has a very solid and reassuring click when open or close. Were the man still around, this probably would have done better.But the sound is the winner for me. I'm am exchange the buds for the pods, today!

Title: Favorite Purchase of the Year
Review: I purchased these as a gift for my wife.  At first, she wasn't sure if she would use them but they quickly became her favorite accessory.  She uses them when watching TV on her phone and needs to walk away for a moment with no need to carry her phone with her; she hooks them up to our Apple TV and can freely move around without having to lug anything else around.  She connects to her work laptop and uses them when grading her students' multimedia projects.  They fit her well (I have a pair as well and they are quite comfortable), they have outstanding battery life (she's not one to remember to charge accessories, but these last weeks without a need for a charge), and they just work.  Who has time to fiddle with bluetooth connections and such?  Highly recommended.

Title: Many great features
Review: I love these earbuds and never leave home without them! The wireless connectivity is great and the range is much larger than I initially thought. 4 stars for battery because I can tell that the battery is getting worse now that I have had them for a few months. I am very hard on my headphones but they still do hold up and there is no cord to get tangled! The sound quality is great as well as noise cancellation, though they do not hold up when compared to my Bose on ear wireless headphones, which is to be expected. I have struggled to get the controls to work (like tapping to pause) but I suspect that is user error. The mic is decent, though it could be better. It is super helpful to have these headphones connected to my Apple Watch and iPhone. I highly recommend them for daily use.

I love these so much I use them all the time and can’t remember life without them😂 they are really pricey but thank me later you will not regret buying these!

Title: I didn’t know I needed this in my life
Review: I’ve had these for over two months now and I absolutely love them. I was hesitant on getting them at first because of the price, but I use them literally everywhere. Easy to sleep with them in your ears and great for video calls! I don’t regret making this purchase and I’m glad I did because I can now move freely without wires getting in the way. Also, if you have an iPhone 8 or above, you don’t have to worry about charging your phone and listening to music at the same time!

Title: Fake EarPods
Review: They’re fine quality but fake found this out when I lost one and order a new one replacement EarPods from apple please don’t buy waste of money

Title: Miserable experience
Review: My airpods worked for a couple of months after which the left airpod stopped connecting. I booked an appointment with apple store. Of course when I went to the store the left airpod was working. Since then it has not been working.

Title: Not impressed
Review: I love Apple, but these airpods slide out of your ear unless you have non slip covers. Additionally, for as pricey as they are, they quit working a month later. They sometimes pair and sometimes don't. I was shocked given Apple has a high quality product generally speaking. I bought Boltune wireless buds and they work just the same and stay in - very sturdy - for 1/3 the price!

Title: Apple need you say more?
Review: A brand that is synonymous with quality. Used between Iphone, iPad and iPod without a problem. These are nit noise canceling but ambient noise is adequately shielded by design. Very comfortable and microphone makes talking hands free on the phone convenient. Charging is fast too.

Title: Only had these for 4 months and the are not working
Review: I ordered these as a Christmas Gift, they have been in use since January 2020 it is April 2020 and they are no longer working. The phone has been updated, the air pods have been reset and nothing. This is disappointing.

Title: It is a amazing product would recommend
Review: I recommend this product to others because they make it easy to listen to music because you just pop them in your ear and do not make your ear sore or make your ear hurt.What sets it apart from other products is that it is very simple and there has not been a product made like it before on the market today .In my opinion the best thing about this product is it is very easy to use for anything.A down fall that a future consumer might have is that they discharge after a while but if you don’t mind that then you should definitely go and get AirPods.

Title: convenient
Review: The AirPods are truly convenient. But the sound and battery are just ok.

Title: Don’t stay in place but the sound quality is good
Review: These aren’t the most comfortable because I feel like I really have to jam these in my ears & twist them so They stay in place. If doing any moderately rigorous jog or higher, these continually need to be readjusted. I do love that the case charges & the battery life on both the case & the buds is good! They are noise canceling enough for my needs & were so so user friendly to set upUpdate—3 months in, the sound sucks...it’s very low & ive followed various bits of input to clean, turn off/on Bluetooth etc & nothing worked. After less than 3 mo, that’s not acceptable

Title: Very satisfied
Review: Very satisfied with these AirPods from Apple.
Bought these in January and they already quit working!!! Too much money for them to go out that quick!!!

Title: Just as described!
Review: Perfect!

Title: Disappointed
Review: My niece has had hers for a while and loved them. So I thought I would give them a try.The first issue I have with them is the battery does not last longer than 3 hours. (That might be my bad, maybe they are not designed to.) If I am going to be on a call longer than 3 hours, I do like that i can use one earbud and the other can stay charging in the case. I do lose any noise canceling that it does that way. In addition sometimes the one earbud will not have audio. I have to put in and take it out of the case a few times to get it to work, so as long as I try switching the earbud before the one dies I can talk longer than 3 hours.The next issue I have is they do not always connect to my iPhone 11 and/or my Samsung Note 10+. I actually have better luck with the Samsung than the iPhone. Once I get the Samsung to connect it will almost always do so, the audio might cut in and out but they connect. The iPhone on the other hand will say it is connected but there will be no audio. It is frustrating, maybe it is the two phones that cause the issues, I am not sure. I bought them because so many loved them, but I would not recommend them at unless you really do not talk long on your phone and only  had one phone. Then maybe you would have less issues than I have had.

Title: Absolutely great!
Review: I’m 64 and have a high frequency hearing loss. These sound great, even to me! Crisp, clear with solid bass. Pairing is automatic. Couldn’t be simpler. (I have an iPhone 7 Plus) Very comfortable to wear. I have not had them long enough to judge battery life, but I’m sure they will do well.
